CAM_DURATION.DisplayName: Duration that shutter is held open
CAM_DURATION.Description: How long the shutter will be held open in 10ths of a second (i.e. enter 10 for 1second, 50 for 5seconds)

CAM_FEEDBACK_PIN.Description: pin number to use for save accurate camera feedback messages. If set to -1 then don't use a pin flag for this, otherwise this is a pin number which if held high after a picture trigger order, will save camera messages when camera really takes a picture. A universal camera hot shoe is needed. The pin should be held high for at least 2 milliseconds for reliable trigger detection. See also the CAM_FEEDBACK_POL option. If using AUX4 pin on a Pixhawk then a fast capture method is used that allows for the trigger time to be as short as one microsecond.
CAM_FEEDBACK_PIN.Values: -1:Disabled,50:PX4 AUX1,51:PX4 AUX2,52:PX4 AUX3,53:PX4 AUX4(fast capture),54:PX4 AUX5,55:PX4 AUX6

CAM_FEEDBACK_POL.Description: Polarity for feedback pin. If this is 1 then the feedback pin should go high on trigger. If set to 0 then it should go low

CAM_MAX_ROLL.Description: Postpone shooting if roll is greater than limit. (0=Disable, will shoot regardless of roll).

CAM_MIN_INTERVAL.Description: Postpone shooting if previous picture was taken less than preset time(ms) ago.

CAM_RELAY_ON.Description: This sets whether the relay goes high or low when it triggers. Note that you should also set RELAY_DEFAULT appropriately for your camera

CAM_SERVO_OFF.Description: PWM value to move servo to when shutter is deactivated

CAM_SERVO_ON.Description: PWM value to move servo to when shutter is activated

CAM_TRIGG_DIST.Description: Distance in meters between camera triggers. If this value is non-zero then the camera will trigger whenever the GPS position changes by this number of meters regardless of what mode the APM is in. Note that this parameter can also be set in an auto mission using the DO_SET_CAM_TRIGG_DIST command, allowing you to enable/disable the triggering of the camera during the flight.

CAM_TRIGG_TYPE.Description: how to trigger the camera to take a picture

CIRCLE_RADIUS.Description: Defines the radius of the circle the vehicle will fly when in Circle flight mode

CIRCLE_RATE.Description: Circle mode's turn rate in deg/sec. Positive to turn clockwise, negative for counter clockwise

COMPASS_AUTODEC.Description: Enable or disable the automatic calculation of the declination based on gps location

COMPASS_CAL_FIT.Description: This controls the fitness level required for a successful compass calibration. A lower value makes for a stricter fit (less likely to pass). This is the value used for the primary magnetometer. Other magnetometers get double the value.

COMPASS_DEC.Description: An angle to compensate between the true north and magnetic north

COMPASS_DEV_ID.Description: Compass device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

COMPASS_DEV_ID2.Description: Second compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

COMPASS_DEV_ID3.Description: Third compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

COMPASS_DIA_X.Description: DIA_X in the compass soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA_Y.Description: DIA_Y in the compass soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA_Z.Description: DIA_Z in the compass soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA2_X.Description: DIA_X in the compass2 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA2_Y.Description: DIA_Y in the compass2 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA2_Z.Description: DIA_Z in the compass2 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA3_X.Description: DIA_X in the compass3 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA3_Y.Description: DIA_Y in the compass3 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA3_Z.Description: DIA_Z in the compass3 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_EXTERN2.DisplayName: Compass2 is attached via an external cable
COMPASS_EXTERN2.Description: Configure second compass so it is attached externally. This is auto-detected on PX4 and Pixhawk. If set to 0 or 1 then auto-detection by bus connection can override the value. If set to 2 then auto-detection will be disabled.

COMPASS_EXTERN3.DisplayName: Compass3 is attached via an external cable
COMPASS_EXTERN3.Description: Configure third compass so it is attached externally. This is auto-detected on PX4 and Pixhawk. If set to 0 or 1 then auto-detection by bus connection can override the value. If set to 2 then auto-detection will be disabled.

COMPASS_EXTERNAL.DisplayName: Compass is attached via an external cable
COMPASS_EXTERNAL.Description: Configure compass so it is attached externally. This is auto-detected on PX4 and Pixhawk. Set to 1 if the compass is externally connected. When externally connected the COMPASS_ORIENT option operates independently of the AHRS_ORIENTATION board orientation option. If set to 0 or 1 then auto-detection by bus connection can override the value. If set to 2 then auto-detection will be disabled.

COMPASS_LEARN.Description: Enable or disable the automatic learning of compass offsets. You can enable learning either using a compass-only method that is suitable only for fixed wing aircraft or using the offsets learnt by the active EKF state estimator. If this option is enabled then the learnt offsets are saved when you disarm the vehicle.

COMPASS_MOT_X.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation for body frame X axis
COMPASS_MOT_X.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's x-axis values to compensate for motor interference
COMPASS_MOT_X.Units: Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle

COMPASS_MOT_Y.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation for body frame Y axis
COMPASS_MOT_Y.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's y-axis values to compensate for motor interference
COMPASS_MOT_Y.Units: Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle

COMPASS_MOT_Z.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation for body frame Z axis
COMPASS_MOT_Z.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's z-axis values to compensate for motor interference
COMPASS_MOT_Z.Units: Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle

COMPASS_MOT2_X.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation to compass2 for body frame X axis
COMPASS_MOT2_X.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass2's x-axis values to compensate for motor interference
COMPASS_MOT2_X.Units: Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle

COMPASS_MOT2_Y.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation to compass2 for body frame Y axis
COMPASS_MOT2_Y.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass2's y-axis values to compensate for motor interference
COMPASS_MOT2_Y.Units: Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle

COMPASS_MOT2_Z.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation to compass2 for body frame Z axis
COMPASS_MOT2_Z.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass2's z-axis values to compensate for motor interference
COMPASS_MOT2_Z.Units: Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle

COMPASS_MOT3_X.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation to compass3 for body frame X axis
COMPASS_MOT3_X.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass3's x-axis values to compensate for motor interference
COMPASS_MOT3_X.Units: Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle

COMPASS_MOT3_Y.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation to compass3 for body frame Y axis
COMPASS_MOT3_Y.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass3's y-axis values to compensate for motor interference
COMPASS_MOT3_Y.Units: Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle

COMPASS_MOT3_Z.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation to compass3 for body frame Z axis
COMPASS_MOT3_Z.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass3's z-axis values to compensate for motor interference
COMPASS_MOT3_Z.Units: Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle

COMPASS_MOTCT.Description: Set motor interference compensation type to disabled, throttle or current. Do not change manually.

COMPASS_ODI_X.Description: ODI_X in the compass soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ODI_Y.Description: ODI_Y in the compass soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ODI_Z.Description: ODI_Z in the compass soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ODI2_X.Description: ODI_X in the compass2 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ODI2_Y.Description: ODI_Y in the compass2 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ODI2_Z.Description: ODI_Z in the compass2 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ODI3_X.Description: ODI_X in the compass3 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ODI3_Y.Description: ODI_Y in the compass3 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ODI3_Z.Description: ODI_Z in the compass3 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_OFFS_MAX.Description: This sets the maximum allowed compass offset in calibration and arming checks

COMPASS_OFS_X.DisplayName: Compass offsets in milligauss on the X axis
COMPASS_OFS_X.Description: Offset to be added to the compass x-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

COMPASS_OFS_Y.DisplayName: Compass offsets in milligauss on the Y axis
COMPASS_OFS_Y.Description: Offset to be added to the compass y-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

COMPASS_OFS_Z.DisplayName: Compass offsets in milligauss on the Z axis
COMPASS_OFS_Z.Description: Offset to be added to the compass z-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

COMPASS_OFS2_X.DisplayName: Compass2 offsets in milligauss on the X axis
COMPASS_OFS2_X.Description: Offset to be added to compass2's x-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

COMPASS_OFS2_Y.DisplayName: Compass2 offsets in milligauss on the Y axis
COMPASS_OFS2_Y.Description: Offset to be added to compass2's y-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

COMPASS_OFS2_Z.DisplayName: Compass2 offsets in milligauss on the Z axis
COMPASS_OFS2_Z.Description: Offset to be added to compass2's z-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

COMPASS_OFS3_X.DisplayName: Compass3 offsets in milligauss on the X axis
COMPASS_OFS3_X.Description: Offset to be added to compass3's x-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

COMPASS_OFS3_Y.DisplayName: Compass3 offsets in milligauss on the Y axis
COMPASS_OFS3_Y.Description: Offset to be added to compass3's y-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

COMPASS_OFS3_Z.DisplayName: Compass3 offsets in milligauss on the Z axis
COMPASS_OFS3_Z.Description: Offset to be added to compass3's z-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

COMPASS_ORIENT.Description: The orientation of the compass relative to the autopilot board. This will default to the right value for each board type, but can be changed if you have an external compass. See the documentation for your external compass for the right value. The correct orientation should give the X axis forward, the Y axis to the right and the Z axis down. So if your aircraft is pointing west it should show a positive value for the Y axis, and a value close to zero for the X axis. On a PX4 or Pixhawk with an external compass the correct value is zero if the compass is correctly oriented. NOTE: This orientation is combined with any AHRS_ORIENTATION setting.

COMPASS_ORIENT2.Description: The orientation of the second compass relative to the frame (if external) or autopilot board (if internal).

COMPASS_ORIENT3.Description: The orientation of the third compass relative to the frame (if external) or autopilot board (if internal).

COMPASS_PRIMARY.Description: If more than one compass is available this selects which compass is the primary. Normally 0=External, 1=Internal. If no External compass is attached this parameter is ignored

COMPASS_USE.Description: Enable or disable the use of the compass (instead of the GPS) for determining heading

COMPASS_USE2.Description: Enable or disable the second compass for determining heading.

COMPASS_USE3.Description: Enable or disable the third compass for determining heading.

EK2_ABIAS_P_NSE.Description: This noise controls the growth of the vertical accelerometer delta velocity bias state error estimate. Increasing it makes accelerometer bias estimation faster and noisier.

EK2_ACC_P_NSE.Description: This control disturbance noise controls the growth of estimated error due to accelerometer measurement errors excluding bias. Increasing it makes the flter trust the accelerometer measurements less and other measurements more.

EK2_ALT_M_NSE.Description: This is the RMS value of noise in the altitude measurement. Increasing it reduces the weighting of the baro measurement and will make the filter respond more slowly to baro measurement errors, but will make it more sensitive to GPS and accelerometer errors.

EK2_ALT_SOURCE.Description: This parameter controls the primary height sensor used by the EKF. If the selected option cannot be used, it will default to Baro as the primary height source. Setting 0 will use the baro altitude at all times. Setting 1 uses the range finder and is only available in combination with optical flow navigation (EK2_GPS_TYPE = 3). Setting 2 uses GPS. Setting 3 uses the range beacon data. NOTE - the EK2_RNG_USE_HGT parameter can be used to switch to range-finder when close to the ground.
EK2_ALT_SOURCE.Values: 0:Use Baro, 1:Use Range Finder, 2:Use GPS, 3:Use Range Beacon

EK2_BCN_DELAY.Description: This is the number of msec that the range beacon measurements lag behind the inertial measurements. It is the time from the end of the optical flow averaging period and does not include the time delay due to the 100msec of averaging within the flow sensor.

EK2_BCN_I_GTE.Description: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the range beacon measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

EK2_BCN_M_NSE.Description: This is the RMS value of noise in the range beacon measurement. Increasing it reduces the weighting on this measurement.

EK2_CHECK_SCALE.Description: This scales the thresholds that are used to check GPS accuracy before it is used by the EKF. A value of 100 is the default. Values greater than 100 increase and values less than 100 reduce the maximum GPS error the EKF will accept. A value of 200 will double the allowable GPS error.

EK2_EAS_I_GATE.Description: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the airspeed measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

EK2_EAS_M_NSE.Description: This is the RMS value of noise in equivalent airspeed measurements used by planes. Increasing it reduces the weighting of airspeed measurements and will make wind speed estimates less noisy and slower to converge. Increasing also increases navigation errors when dead-reckoning without GPS measurements.

EK2_ENABLE.Description: This enables EKF2. Enabling EKF2 only makes the maths run, it does not mean it will be used for flight control. To use it for flight control set AHRS_EKF_TYPE=2. A reboot or restart will need to be performed after changing the value of EK2_ENABLE for it to take effect.

EK2_FLOW_DELAY.Description: This is the number of msec that the optical flow measurements lag behind the inertial measurements. It is the time from the end of the optical flow averaging period and does not include the time delay due to the 100msec of averaging within the flow sensor.

EK2_FLOW_I_GATE.Description: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the optical flow innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

EK2_FLOW_M_NSE.Description: This is the RMS value of noise and errors in optical flow measurements. Increasing it reduces the weighting on these measurements.

EK2_GBIAS_P_NSE.Description: This state process noise controls growth of the gyro delta angle bias state error estimate. Increasing it makes rate gyro bias estimation faster and noisier.

EK2_GLITCH_RAD.Description: This controls the maximum radial uncertainty in position between the value predicted by the filter and the value measured by the GPS before the filter position and velocity states are reset to the GPS. Making this value larger allows the filter to ignore larger GPS glitches but also means that non-GPS errors such as IMU and compass can create a larger error in position before the filter is forced back to the GPS position.

EK2_GPS_CHECK.Description: This is a 1 byte bitmap controlling which GPS preflight checks are performed. Set to 0 to bypass all checks. Set to 255 perform all checks. Set to 3 to check just the number of satellites and HDoP. Set to 31 for the most rigorous checks that will still allow checks to pass when the copter is moving, eg launch from a boat.
EK2_GPS_CHECK.Bitmask: 0:NSats,1:HDoP,2:speed error,3:position error,4:yaw error,5:pos drift,6:vert speed,7:horiz speed

EK2_GPS_DELAY.Description: This is the number of msec that the GPS measurements lag behind the inertial measurements.

EK2_GPS_TYPE.Description: This controls use of GPS measurements : 0 = use 3D velocity & 2D position, 1 = use 2D velocity and 2D position, 2 = use 2D position, 3 = Inhibit GPS use - this can be useful when flying with an optical flow sensor in an environment where GPS quality is poor and subject to large multipath errors.
EK2_GPS_TYPE.Values: 0:GPS 3D Vel and 2D Pos, 1:GPS 2D vel and 2D pos, 2:GPS 2D pos, 3:No GPS

EK2_GSCL_P_NSE.Description: This noise controls the rate of gyro scale factor learning. Increasing it makes rate gyro scale factor estimation faster and noisier.

EK2_GYRO_P_NSE.Description: This control disturbance noise controls the growth of estimated error due to gyro measurement errors excluding bias. Increasing it makes the flter trust the gyro measurements less and other measurements more.

EK2_HGT_DELAY.Description: This is the number of msec that the Height measurements lag behind the inertial measurements.

EK2_HGT_I_GATE.Description: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the height measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

EK2_IMU_MASK.Description: 1 byte bitmap of IMUs to use in EKF2. A separate instance of EKF2 will be started for each IMU selected. Set to 1 to use the first IMU only (default), set to 2 to use the second IMU only, set to 3 to use the first and second IMU. Additional IMU's can be used up to a maximum of 6 if memory and processing resources permit. There may be insufficient memory and processing resources to run multiple instances. If this occurs EKF2 will fail to start.

EK2_LOG_MASK.Description: This sets the IMU mask of sensors to do full logging for

EK2_MAG_CAL.Description: This determines when the filter will use the 3-axis magnetometer fusion model that estimates both earth and body fixed magnetic field states and when it will use a simpler magnetic heading fusion model that does not use magnetic field states. The 3-axis magnetometer fusion is only suitable for use when the external magnetic field environment is stable. EK2_MAG_CAL = 0 uses heading fusion on ground, 3-axis fusion in-flight, and is the default setting for Plane users. EK2_MAG_CAL = 1 uses 3-axis fusion only when manoeuvring. EK2_MAG_CAL = 2 uses heading fusion at all times, is recommended if the external magnetic field is varying and is the default for rovers. EK2_MAG_CAL = 3 uses heading fusion on the ground and 3-axis fusion after the first in-air field and yaw reset has completed, and is the default for copters. EK2_MAG_CAL = 4 uses 3-axis fusion at all times. NOTE : Use of simple heading magnetometer fusion makes vehicle compass calibration and alignment errors harder for the EKF to detect which reduces the sensitivity of the Copter EKF failsafe algorithm. NOTE: The fusion mode can be forced to 2 for specific EKF cores using the EK2_MAG_MASK parameter.
EK2_MAG_CAL.Values: 0:When flying,1:When manoeuvring,2:Never,3:After first climb yaw reset,4:Always

EK2_MAG_I_GATE.Description: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the magnetometer measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

EK2_MAG_M_NSE.Description: This is the RMS value of noise in magnetometer measurements. Increasing it reduces the weighting on these measurements.

EK2_MAG_MASK.DisplayName: Bitmask of active EKF cores that will always use heading fusion
EK2_MAG_MASK.Description: 1 byte bitmap of EKF cores that will disable magnetic field states and use simple magnetic heading fusion at all times. This parameter enables specified cores to be used as a backup for flight into an environment with high levels of external magnetic interference which may degrade the EKF attitude estimate when using 3-axis magnetometer fusion. NOTE : Use of a different magnetometer fusion algorithm on different cores makes unwanted EKF core switches due to magnetometer errors more likely.

EK2_MAGB_P_NSE.Description: This state process noise controls the growth of body magnetic field state error estimates. Increasing it makes magnetometer bias error estimation faster and noisier.

EK2_MAGE_P_NSE.Description: This state process noise controls the growth of earth magnetic field state error estimates. Increasing it makes earth magnetic field estimation faster and noisier.

EK2_MAX_FLOW.Description: This sets the magnitude maximum optical flow rate in rad/sec that will be accepted by the filter

EK2_NOAID_M_NSE.Description: This sets the amount of position variation that the EKF allows for when operating without external measurements (eg GPS or optical flow). Increasing this parameter makes the EKF attitude estimate less sensitive to vehicle manoeuvres but more sensitive to IMU errors.

EK2_POS_I_GATE.Description: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the GPS position measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

EK2_POSNE_M_NSE.Description: This sets the GPS horizontal position observation noise. Increasing it reduces the weighting of GPS horizontal position measurements.

EK2_RNG_I_GATE.Description: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the range finder innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

EK2_RNG_M_NSE.Description: This is the RMS value of noise in the range finder measurement. Increasing it reduces the weighting on this measurement.

EK2_RNG_USE_HGT.Description: The range finder will be used as the primary height source when below a specified percentage of the sensor maximum as set by the RNGFND_MAX_CM parameter. Set to -1 to prevent range finder use.

EK2_RNG_USE_SPD.Description: The range finder will not be used as the primary height source when the horizontal ground speed is greater than this value.

EK2_TAU_OUTPUT.Description: Sets the time constant of the output complementary filter/predictor in centi-seconds.

EK2_TERR_GRAD.Description: Specifies the maximum gradient of the terrain below the vehicle when it is using range finder as a height reference

EK2_VEL_I_GATE.Description: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the GPS velocity measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements willbe rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

EK2_VELD_M_NSE.Description: This sets a lower limit on the speed accuracy reported by the GPS receiver that is used to set vertical velocity observation noise. If the model of receiver used does not provide a speed accurcy estimate, then the parameter value will be used. Increasing it reduces the weighting of the GPS vertical velocity measurements.

EK2_VELNE_M_NSE.Description: This sets a lower limit on the speed accuracy reported by the GPS receiver that is used to set horizontal velocity observation noise. If the model of receiver used does not provide a speed accurcy estimate, then the parameter value will be used. Increasing it reduces the weighting of the GPS horizontal velocity measurements.

EK2_WIND_P_NSE.Description: This state process noise controls the growth of wind state error estimates. Increasing it makes wind estimation faster and noisier.

EK2_WIND_PSCALE.DisplayName: Height rate to wind process noise scaler
EK2_WIND_PSCALE.Description: This controls how much the process noise on the wind states is increased when gaining or losing altitude to take into account changes in wind speed and direction with altitude. Increasing this parameter increases how rapidly the wind states adapt when changing altitude, but does make wind velocity estimation noiser.

EK2_YAW_I_GATE.Description: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the magnetometer yaw measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

EK2_YAW_M_NSE.Description: This is the RMS value of noise in yaw measurements from the magnetometer. Increasing it reduces the weighting on these measurements.

EK3_ABIAS_P_NSE.Description: This noise controls the growth of the vertical accelerometer delta velocity bias state error estimate. Increasing it makes accelerometer bias estimation faster and noisier.

EK3_ACC_BIAS_LIM.Description: The accelerometer bias state will be limited to +- this value

EK3_ACC_P_NSE.Description: This control disturbance noise controls the growth of estimated error due to accelerometer measurement errors excluding bias. Increasing it makes the flter trust the accelerometer measurements less and other measurements more.

EK3_ALT_M_NSE.Description: This is the RMS value of noise in the altitude measurement. Increasing it reduces the weighting of the baro measurement and will make the filter respond more slowly to baro measurement errors, but will make it more sensitive to GPS and accelerometer errors.

EK3_ALT_SOURCE.Description: This parameter controls the primary height sensor used by the EKF. If the selected option cannot be used, it will default to Baro as the primary height source. Setting 0 will use the baro altitude at all times. Setting 1 uses the range finder and is only available in combination with optical flow navigation (EK3_GPS_TYPE = 3). Setting 2 uses GPS. Setting 3 uses the range beacon data. NOTE - the EK3_RNG_USE_HGT parameter can be used to switch to range-finder when close to the ground.
EK3_ALT_SOURCE.Values: 0:Use Baro, 1:Use Range Finder, 2:Use GPS, 3:Use Range Beacon

EK3_BCN_DELAY.Description: This is the number of msec that the range beacon measurements lag behind the inertial measurements.

EK3_BCN_I_GTE.Description: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the range beacon measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

EK3_BCN_M_NSE.Description: This is the RMS value of noise in the range beacon measurement. Increasing it reduces the weighting on this measurement.

EK3_CHECK_SCALE.Description: This scales the thresholds that are used to check GPS accuracy before it is used by the EKF. A value of 100 is the default. Values greater than 100 increase and values less than 100 reduce the maximum GPS error the EKF will accept. A value of 200 will double the allowable GPS error.

EK3_EAS_I_GATE.Description: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the airspeed measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

EK3_EAS_M_NSE.Description: This is the RMS value of noise in equivalent airspeed measurements used by planes. Increasing it reduces the weighting of airspeed measurements and will make wind speed estimates less noisy and slower to converge. Increasing also increases navigation errors when dead-reckoning without GPS measurements.

EK3_ENABLE.Description: This enables EKF3. Enabling EKF3 only makes the maths run, it does not mean it will be used for flight control. To use it for flight control set AHRS_EKF_TYPE=3. A reboot or restart will need to be performed after changing the value of EK3_ENABLE for it to take effect.

EK3_FLOW_DELAY.Description: This is the number of msec that the optical flow measurements lag behind the inertial measurements. It is the time from the end of the optical flow averaging period and does not include the time delay due to the 100msec of averaging within the flow sensor.

EK3_FLOW_I_GATE.Description: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the optical flow innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

EK3_FLOW_M_NSE.Description: This is the RMS value of noise and errors in optical flow measurements. Increasing it reduces the weighting on these measurements.

EK3_GBIAS_P_NSE.Description: This state process noise controls growth of the gyro delta angle bias state error estimate. Increasing it makes rate gyro bias estimation faster and noisier.

EK3_GLITCH_RAD.Description: This controls the maximum radial uncertainty in position between the value predicted by the filter and the value measured by the GPS before the filter position and velocity states are reset to the GPS. Making this value larger allows the filter to ignore larger GPS glitches but also means that non-GPS errors such as IMU and compass can create a larger error in position before the filter is forced back to the GPS position.

EK3_GPS_CHECK.Description: This is a 1 byte bitmap controlling which GPS preflight checks are performed. Set to 0 to bypass all checks. Set to 255 perform all checks. Set to 3 to check just the number of satellites and HDoP. Set to 31 for the most rigorous checks that will still allow checks to pass when the copter is moving, eg launch from a boat.
EK3_GPS_CHECK.Bitmask: 0:NSats,1:HDoP,2:speed error,3:position error,4:yaw error,5:pos drift,6:vert speed,7:horiz speed

EK3_GPS_TYPE.Description: This controls use of GPS measurements : 0 = use 3D velocity & 2D position, 1 = use 2D velocity and 2D position, 2 = use 2D position, 3 = Inhibit GPS use - this can be useful when flying with an optical flow sensor in an environment where GPS quality is poor and subject to large multipath errors.
EK3_GPS_TYPE.Values: 0:GPS 3D Vel and 2D Pos, 1:GPS 2D vel and 2D pos, 2:GPS 2D pos, 3:No GPS

EK3_GYRO_P_NSE.Description: This control disturbance noise controls the growth of estimated error due to gyro measurement errors excluding bias. Increasing it makes the flter trust the gyro measurements less and other measurements more.

EK3_HGT_DELAY.Description: This is the number of msec that the Height measurements lag behind the inertial measurements.

EK3_HGT_I_GATE.Description: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the height measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

EK3_IMU_MASK.Description: 1 byte bitmap of IMUs to use in EKF3. A separate instance of EKF3 will be started for each IMU selected. Set to 1 to use the first IMU only (default), set to 2 to use the second IMU only, set to 3 to use the first and second IMU. Additional IMU's can be used up to a maximum of 6 if memory and processing resources permit. There may be insufficient memory and processing resources to run multiple instances. If this occurs EKF3 will fail to start.

EK3_LOG_MASK.Description: This sets the IMU mask of sensors to do full logging for

EK3_MAG_CAL.Description: This determines when the filter will use the 3-axis magnetometer fusion model that estimates both earth and body fixed magnetic field states and when it will use a simpler magnetic heading fusion model that does not use magnetic field states. The 3-axis magnetometer fusion is only suitable for use when the external magnetic field environment is stable. EK3_MAG_CAL = 0 uses heading fusion on ground, 3-axis fusion in-flight, and is the default setting for Plane users. EK3_MAG_CAL = 1 uses 3-axis fusion only when manoeuvring. EK3_MAG_CAL = 2 uses heading fusion at all times, is recommended if the external magnetic field is varying and is the default for rovers. EK3_MAG_CAL = 3 uses heading fusion on the ground and 3-axis fusion after the first in-air field and yaw reset has completed, and is the default for copters. EK3_MAG_CAL = 4 uses 3-axis fusion at all times. NOTE : Use of simple heading magnetometer fusion makes vehicle compass calibration and alignment errors harder for the EKF to detect which reduces the sensitivity of the Copter EKF failsafe algorithm. NOTE: The fusion mode can be forced to 2 for specific EKF cores using the EK3_MAG_MASK parameter.
EK3_MAG_CAL.Values: 0:When flying,1:When manoeuvring,2:Never,3:After first climb yaw reset,4:Always

EK3_MAG_I_GATE.Description: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the magnetometer measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

EK3_MAG_M_NSE.Description: This is the RMS value of noise in magnetometer measurements. Increasing it reduces the weighting on these measurements.

EK3_MAG_MASK.DisplayName: Bitmask of active EKF cores that will always use heading fusion
EK3_MAG_MASK.Description: 1 byte bitmap of EKF cores that will disable magnetic field states and use simple magnetic heading fusion at all times. This parameter enables specified cores to be used as a backup for flight into an environment with high levels of external magnetic interference which may degrade the EKF attitude estimate when using 3-axis magnetometer fusion. NOTE : Use of a different magnetometer fusion algorithm on different cores makes unwanted EKF core switches due to magnetometer errors more likely.

EK3_MAGB_P_NSE.Description: This state process noise controls the growth of body magnetic field state error estimates. Increasing it makes magnetometer bias error estimation faster and noisier.

EK3_MAGE_P_NSE.Description: This state process noise controls the growth of earth magnetic field state error estimates. Increasing it makes earth magnetic field estimation faster and noisier.

EK3_MAX_FLOW.Description: This sets the magnitude maximum optical flow rate in rad/sec that will be accepted by the filter

EK3_NOAID_M_NSE.Description: This sets the amount of position variation that the EKF allows for when operating without external measurements (eg GPS or optical flow). Increasing this parameter makes the EKF attitude estimate less sensitive to vehicle manoeuvres but more sensitive to IMU errors.

EK3_POS_I_GATE.Description: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the GPS position measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

EK3_POSNE_M_NSE.Description: This sets the GPS horizontal position observation noise. Increasing it reduces the weighting of GPS horizontal position measurements.

EK3_RNG_I_GATE.Description: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the range finder innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

EK3_RNG_M_NSE.Description: This is the RMS value of noise in the range finder measurement. Increasing it reduces the weighting on this measurement.

EK3_RNG_USE_HGT.Description: The range finder will be used as the primary height source when below a specified percentage of the sensor maximum as set by the RNGFND_MAX_CM parameter. Set to -1 to prevent range finder use.

EK3_RNG_USE_SPD.Description: The range finder will not be used as the primary height source when the horizontal ground speed is greater than this value.

EK3_TAU_OUTPUT.Description: Sets the time constant of the output complementary filter/predictor in centi-seconds.

EK3_TERR_GRAD.Description: Specifies the maximum gradient of the terrain below the vehicle when it is using range finder as a height reference

EK3_VEL_I_GATE.Description: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the GPS velocity measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements willbe rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

EK3_VELD_M_NSE.Description: This sets a lower limit on the speed accuracy reported by the GPS receiver that is used to set vertical velocity observation noise. If the model of receiver used does not provide a speed accurcy estimate, then the parameter value will be used. Increasing it reduces the weighting of the GPS vertical velocity measurements.

EK3_VELNE_M_NSE.Description: This sets a lower limit on the speed accuracy reported by the GPS receiver that is used to set horizontal velocity observation noise. If the model of receiver used does not provide a speed accurcy estimate, then the parameter value will be used. Increasing it reduces the weighting of the GPS horizontal velocity measurements.

EK3_WIND_P_NSE.Description: This state process noise controls the growth of wind state error estimates. Increasing it makes wind estimation faster and noisier.

EK3_WIND_PSCALE.DisplayName: Height rate to wind process noise scaler
EK3_WIND_PSCALE.Description: This controls how much the process noise on the wind states is increased when gaining or losing altitude to take into account changes in wind speed and direction with altitude. Increasing this parameter increases how rapidly the wind states adapt when changing altitude, but does make wind velocity estimation noiser.

EK3_YAW_I_GATE.Description: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the magnetometer yaw measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

EK3_YAW_M_NSE.Description: This is the RMS value of noise in yaw measurements from the magnetometer. Increasing it reduces the weighting on these measurements.

FENCE_ACTION.Description: What action should be taken when fence is breached

FENCE_ALT_MAX.Description: Maximum altitude allowed before geofence triggers

FENCE_ALT_MIN.Description: Minimum altitude allowed before geofence triggers

FENCE_ENABLE.Description: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the fence functionality

FENCE_MARGIN.Description: Distance that autopilot's should maintain from the fence to avoid a breach

FENCE_RADIUS.Description: Circle fence radius which when breached will cause an RTL

FENCE_TOTAL.Description: Number of polygon points saved in eeprom (do not update manually)

FENCE_TYPE.Description: Enabled fence types held as bitmask
FENCE_TYPE.Values: 0:None,1:Altitude,2:Circle,3:Altitude and Circle,4:Polygon,5:Altitude and Polygon,6:Circle and Polygon,7:All

FLOW_BUS_ID.Description: This is used to select between multiple possible bus IDs for some sensor types. For PX4Flow you can choose 0 to 7 for the 8 possible addresses on the I2C bus.

FLOW_ENABLE.Description: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable optical flow. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable optical flow

FLOW_FXSCALER.DisplayName: X axis optical flow scale factor correction
FLOW_FXSCALER.Description: This sets the parts per thousand scale factor correction applied to the flow sensor X axis optical rate. It can be used to correct for variations in effective focal length. Each positive increment of 1 increases the scale factor applied to the X axis optical flow reading by 0.1%. Negative values reduce the scale factor.

FLOW_FYSCALER.DisplayName: Y axis optical flow scale factor correction
FLOW_FYSCALER.Description: This sets the parts per thousand scale factor correction applied to the flow sensor Y axis optical rate. It can be used to correct for variations in effective focal length. Each positive increment of 1 increases the scale factor applied to the Y axis optical flow reading by 0.1%. Negative values reduce the scale factor.

FLOW_ORIENT_YAW.Description: Specifies the number of centi-degrees that the flow sensor is yawed relative to the vehicle. A sensor with its X-axis pointing to the right of the vehicle X axis has a positive yaw angle.

FLOW_POS_X.Description: X position of the optical flow sensor focal point in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin.

FLOW_POS_Y.Description: Y position of the optical flow sensor focal point in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin.

FLOW_POS_Z.Description: Z position of the optical flow sensor focal point in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin.

FRAME_CONFIG.Description: Set this parameter according to your vehicle/motor configuration

FS_BATT_ENABLE.Description: Controls whether failsafe will be invoked when battery voltage or current runs low

FS_BATT_MAH.Description: Battery capacity remaining to trigger failsafe. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe.

FS_BATT_VOLTAGE.Description: Battery voltage to trigger failsafe. Set to 0 to disable battery voltage failsafe.

FS_CRASH_CHECK.Description: This enables automatic crash checking. When enabled the motors will disarm if a crash is detected.

FS_EKF_ACTION.Description: Controls the action that will be taken when an EKF failsafe is invoked

FS_EKF_THRESH.Description: Allows setting the maximum acceptable compass and velocity variance

FS_GCS_ENABLE.Description: Controls what action to take when GCS heartbeat is lost.
FS_GCS_ENABLE.Values: 0:Disabled,1:Warn only,2:Disarm,3:Enter depth hold mode,4:Enter surface mode

FS_LEAK_ENABLE.Description: Controls what action to take if a leak is detected.

FS_PILOT_INPUT.Description: Controls what action to take if no pilot input has been received after the timeout period specified by the FS_PILOT_TIMEOUT parameter

FS_PILOT_TIMEOUT.DisplayName: Timeout for activation of pilot input failsafe
FS_PILOT_TIMEOUT.Description: Controls the maximum interval between received pilot inputs before the failsafe action is triggered

FS_PRESS_ENABLE.Description: Controls what action to take if internal pressure exceeds FS_PRESS_MAX parameter.

FS_PRESS_MAX.Description: The maximum internal pressure allowed before triggering failsafe. Failsafe action is determined by FS_PRESS_ENABLE parameter

FS_TEMP_ENABLE.Description: Controls what action to take if internal temperature exceeds FS_TEMP_MAX parameter.

FS_TEMP_MAX.Description: The maximum internal temperature allowed before triggering failsafe. Failsafe action is determined by FS_TEMP_ENABLE parameter.

FS_TERRAIN_ENAB.Description: Controls what action to take if terrain information is lost during AUTO mode

GCS_PID_MASK.Description: bitmask of PIDs to send MAVLink PID_TUNING messages for

GND_ALT_OFFSET.Description: altitude offset in meters added to barometric altitude. This is used to allow for automatic adjustment of the base barometric altitude by a ground station equipped with a barometer. The value is added to the barometric altitude read by the aircraft. It is automatically reset to 0 when the barometer is calibrated on each reboot or when a preflight calibration is performed.

GND_EXT_BUS.Description: This selects the bus number for looking for an I2C barometer

GND_PRIMARY.Description: This selects which barometer will be the primary if multiple barometers are found

GND_SPEC_GRAV.Description: This sets the specific gravity of the fluid when flying an underwater ROV.

GND_TEMP.Description: calibrated ground temperature in degrees Celsius

GPS_AUTO_CONFIG.Description: Controls if the autopilot should automatically configure the GPS based on the parameters and default settings

GPS_AUTO_SWITCH.Description: Automatic switchover to GPS reporting best lock

GPS_BLEND_MASK.Description: Determines which of the accuracy measures Horizontal position, Vertical Position and Speed are used to calculate the weighting on each GPS receiver when soft switching has been selected by setting GPS_AUTO_SWITCH to 2

GPS_BLEND_TC.Description: Controls the slowest time constant applied to the calculation of GPS position and height offsets used to adjust different GPS receivers for steady state position differences.

GPS_DELAY_MS.Description: Controls the amount of GPS measurement delay that the autopilot compensates for. Set to zero to use the default delay for the detected GPS type.

GPS_DELAY_MS2.Description: Controls the amount of GPS measurement delay that the autopilot compensates for. Set to zero to use the default delay for the detected GPS type.

GPS_GNSS_MODE.Description: Bitmask for what GNSS system to use on the first GPS (all unchecked or zero to leave GPS as configured)

GPS_GNSS_MODE2.Description: Bitmask for what GNSS system to use on the second GPS (all unchecked or zero to leave GPS as configured)

GPS_INJECT_TO.Description: The GGS can send raw serial packets to inject data to multiple GPSes.
GPS_INJECT_TO.Values: 0:send to first GPS,1:send to 2nd GPS,127:send to all

GPS_MIN_DGPS.DisplayName: Minimum Lock Type Accepted for DGPS
GPS_MIN_DGPS.Description: Sets the minimum type of differential GPS corrections required before allowing to switch into DGPS mode.

GPS_MIN_ELEV.Description: This sets the minimum elevation of satellites above the horizon for them to be used for navigation. Setting this to -100 leaves the minimum elevation set to the GPS modules default.

GPS_POS1_X.Description: X position of the first GPS antenna in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.

GPS_POS1_Y.Description: Y position of the first GPS antenna in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.

GPS_POS1_Z.Description: Z position of the first GPS antenna in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.

GPS_POS2_X.Description: X position of the second GPS antenna in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.

GPS_POS2_Y.Description: Y position of the second GPS antenna in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.

GPS_POS2_Z.Description: Z position of the second GPS antenna in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Use antenna phase centroid location if provided by the manufacturer.

GPS_RATE_MS.Description: Controls how often the GPS should provide a position update. Lowering below 5Hz is not allowed

GPS_RATE_MS2.Description: Controls how often the GPS should provide a position update. Lowering below 5Hz is not allowed

GPS_RAW_DATA.Description: Enable logging of RXM raw data from uBlox which includes carrier phase and pseudo range information. This allows for post processing of dataflash logs for more precise positioning. Note that this requires a raw capable uBlox such as the 6P or 6T.

GPS_SAVE_CFG.Description: Determines whether the configuration for this GPS should be written to non-volatile memory on the GPS. Currently working for UBlox 6 series and above.
GPS_SAVE_CFG.Values: 0:Do not save config,1:Save config,2:Save only when needed

GPS_SBAS_MODE.Description: This sets the SBAS (satellite based augmentation system) mode if available on this GPS. If set to 2 then the SBAS mode is not changed in the GPS. Otherwise the GPS will be reconfigured to enable/disable SBAS. Disabling SBAS may be worthwhile in some parts of the world where an SBAS signal is available but the baseline is too long to be useful.

GPS_SBP_LOGMASK.Description: Masked with the SBP msg_type field to determine whether SBR1/SBR2 data is logged

GRIP_GRAB.Description: PWM value sent to Gripper to initiate grabbing the cargo

GRIP_NEUTRAL.Description: PWM value sent to grabber when not grabbing or releasing

GRIP_REGRAB.Description: Time in seconds that gripper will regrab the cargo to ensure grip has not weakened; 0 to disable

GRIP_RELEASE.Description: PWM value sent to Gripper to release the cargo

INS_ACC_BODYFIX.Description: The body-fixed accelerometer to be used for trim calculation

INS_ACC_ID.Description: Accelerometer sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

INS_ACC2_ID.Description: Accelerometer2 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

INS_ACC2OFFS_X.Description: Accelerometer2 offsets of X axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACC2OFFS_Y.Description: Accelerometer2 offsets of Y axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACC2OFFS_Z.Description: Accelerometer2 offsets of Z axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACC2SCAL_X.Description: Accelerometer2 scaling of X axis. Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACC2SCAL_Y.Description: Accelerometer2 scaling of Y axis Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACC2SCAL_Z.Description: Accelerometer2 scaling of Z axis Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACC3_ID.Description: Accelerometer3 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

INS_ACC3OFFS_X.Description: Accelerometer3 offsets of X axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACC3OFFS_Y.Description: Accelerometer3 offsets of Y axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACC3OFFS_Z.Description: Accelerometer3 offsets of Z axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACC3SCAL_X.Description: Accelerometer3 scaling of X axis. Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACC3SCAL_Y.Description: Accelerometer3 scaling of Y axis Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACC3SCAL_Z.Description: Accelerometer3 scaling of Z axis Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACCEL_FILTER.Description: Filter cutoff frequency for accelerometers. This can be set to a lower value to try to cope with very high vibration levels in aircraft. This option takes effect on the next reboot. A value of zero means no filtering (not recommended!)

INS_ACCOFFS_X.Description: Accelerometer offsets of X axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACCOFFS_Y.Description: Accelerometer offsets of Y axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACCOFFS_Z.Description: Accelerometer offsets of Z axis. This is setup using the acceleration calibration or level operations

INS_ACCSCAL_X.Description: Accelerometer scaling of X axis. Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACCSCAL_Y.Description: Accelerometer scaling of Y axis Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_ACCSCAL_Z.Description: Accelerometer scaling of Z axis Calculated during acceleration calibration routine

INS_FAST_SAMPLE.Description: Mask of IMUs to enable fast sampling on, if available

INS_GYR_CAL.Description: Conrols when automatic gyro calibration is performed

INS_GYR_ID.Description: Gyro sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

INS_GYR2_ID.Description: Gyro2 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

INS_GYR2OFFS_X.Description: Gyro2 sensor offsets of X axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYR2OFFS_Y.Description: Gyro2 sensor offsets of Y axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYR2OFFS_Z.Description: Gyro2 sensor offsets of Z axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYR3_ID.Description: Gyro3 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

INS_GYR3OFFS_X.Description: Gyro3 sensor offsets of X axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYR3OFFS_Y.Description: Gyro3 sensor offsets of Y axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYR3OFFS_Z.Description: Gyro3 sensor offsets of Z axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYRO_FILTER.Description: Filter cutoff frequency for gyroscopes. This can be set to a lower value to try to cope with very high vibration levels in aircraft. This option takes effect on the next reboot. A value of zero means no filtering (not recommended!)

INS_GYROFFS_X.Description: Gyro sensor offsets of X axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYROFFS_Y.Description: Gyro sensor offsets of Y axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_GYROFFS_Z.Description: Gyro sensor offsets of Z axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

INS_POS1_X.Description: X position of the first IMU Accelerometer in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

INS_POS1_Y.Description: Y position of the first IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

INS_POS1_Z.Description: Z position of the first IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

INS_POS2_X.Description: X position of the second IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

INS_POS2_Y.Description: Y position of the second IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

INS_POS2_Z.Description: Z position of the second IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

INS_POS3_X.Description: X position of the third IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

INS_POS3_Y.Description: Y position of the third IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

INS_POS3_Z.Description: Z position of the third IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

INS_STILL_THRESH.DisplayName: Stillness threshold for detecting if we are moving
INS_STILL_THRESH.Description: Threshold to tolerate vibration to determine if vehicle is motionless. This depends on the frame type and if there is a constant vibration due to motors before launch or after landing. Total motionless is about 0.05. Suggested values: Planes/rover use 0.1, multirotors use 1, tradHeli uses 5

INS_TRIM_OPTION.Description: Specifies how the accel cal routine determines the trims
INS_TRIM_OPTION.Values: 0:Don't adjust the trims,1:Assume first orientation was level,2:Assume ACC_BODYFIX is perfectly aligned to the vehicle

INS_USE.DisplayName: Use first IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates
INS_USE.Description: Use first IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates

INS_USE2.DisplayName: Use second IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates
INS_USE2.Description: Use second IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates

INS_USE3.DisplayName: Use third IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates
INS_USE3.Description: Use third IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates

JS_GAIN_DEFAULT.Description: Default gain at boot, must be in range [JS_GAIN_MIN , JS_GAIN_MAX]

JS_GAIN_STEPS.Description: Controls the number of steps between minimum and maximum joystick gain when the gain is adjusted using buttons. Set to 1 to always use JS_GAIN_DEFAULT.

JS_LIGHTS_STEPS.Description: Number of steps in brightness between minimum and maximum brightness

JS_THR_GAIN.Description: Scalar for gain on the throttle channel

LEAK1_LOGIC.DisplayName: Default reading of leak detector when dry
LEAK1_LOGIC.Description: Default reading of leak detector when dry

LEAK1_PIN.DisplayName: Pin that leak detector is connected to
LEAK1_PIN.Description: Pin that the leak detector is connected to
LEAK1_PIN.Values: -1:Disabled,50:Pixhawk Aux1,51:Pixhawk Aux2,52:Pixhawk Aux3,53:Pixhawk Aux4,54:Pixhawk Aux5,55:Pixhawk Aux6,13:Pixhawk 3.3ADC1,14:Pixhawk 3.3ADC2,15:Pixhawk 6.6ADC

LEAK2_LOGIC.DisplayName: Default reading of leak detector when dry
LEAK2_LOGIC.Description: Default reading of leak detector when dry

LEAK2_PIN.DisplayName: Pin that leak detector is connected to
LEAK2_PIN.Description: Pin that the leak detector is connected to
LEAK2_PIN.Values: -1:Disabled,50:Pixhawk Aux1,51:Pixhawk Aux2,52:Pixhawk Aux3,53:Pixhawk Aux4,54:Pixhawk Aux5,55:Pixhawk Aux6,13:Pixhawk 3.3ADC1,14:Pixhawk 3.3ADC2,15:Pixhawk 6.6ADC

LEAK3_LOGIC.DisplayName: Default reading of leak detector when dry
LEAK3_LOGIC.Description: Default reading of leak detector when dry

LEAK3_PIN.DisplayName: Pin that leak detector is connected to
LEAK3_PIN.Description: Pin that the leak detector is connected to
LEAK3_PIN.Values: -1:Disabled,50:Pixhawk Aux1,51:Pixhawk Aux2,52:Pixhawk Aux3,53:Pixhawk Aux4,54:Pixhawk Aux5,55:Pixhawk Aux6,13:Pixhawk 3.3ADC1,14:Pixhawk 3.3ADC2,15:Pixhawk 6.6ADC

LOG_BACKEND_TYPE.Description: 0 for None, 1 for File, 2 for dataflash mavlink, 3 for both file and dataflash

LOG_BITMASK.Description: 4 byte bitmap of log types to enable

LOG_DISARMED.Description: If LOG_DISARMED is set to 1 then logging will be enabled while disarmed. This can make for very large logfiles but can help a lot when tracking down startup issues

LOG_FILE_BUFSIZE.DisplayName: Maximum DataFlash File Backend buffer size (in kilobytes)
LOG_FILE_BUFSIZE.Description: The DataFlash_File backend uses a buffer to store data before writing to the block device. Raising this value may reduce "gaps" in your SD card logging. This buffer size may be reduced depending on available memory. PixHawk requires at least 4 kilobytes. Maximum value available here is 64 kilobytes.

LOG_FILE_DSRMROT.DisplayName: Stop logging to current file on disarm
LOG_FILE_DSRMROT.Description: When set, the current log file is closed when the vehicle is disarmed. If LOG_DISARMED is set then a fresh log will be opened.

LOG_REPLAY.DisplayName: Enable logging of information needed for Replay
LOG_REPLAY.Description: If LOG_REPLAY is set to 1 then the EKF2 state estimator will log detailed information needed for diagnosing problems with the Kalman filter. It is suggested that you also raise LOG_FILE_BUFSIZE to give more buffer space for logging and use a high quality microSD card to ensure no sensor data is lost

MAG_ENABLE.Description: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable the compass. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable the compass

MANUAL_SLEW_RATE.Description: This is slew rate in %/s that will be used in manual mode to avoid large step outputs on the motors. Set to zero to disable.

MIS_RESTART.DisplayName: Mission Restart when entering Auto mode
MIS_RESTART.Description: Controls mission starting point when entering Auto mode (either restart from beginning of mission or resume from last command run)

MIS_TOTAL.Description: The number of mission mission items that has been loaded by the ground station. Do not change this manually.

MNT_ANGMAX_PAN.Description: Maximum physical pan (yaw) angular position of the mount

MNT_ANGMAX_ROL.Description: Maximum physical roll angular position of the mount

MNT_ANGMAX_TIL.Description: Maximum physical tilt (pitch) angular position of the mount

MNT_ANGMIN_PAN.Description: Minimum physical pan (yaw) angular position of mount.

MNT_ANGMIN_ROL.Description: Minimum physical roll angular position of mount.

MNT_ANGMIN_TIL.Description: Minimum physical tilt (pitch) angular position of mount.

MNT_DEFLT_MODE.Description: Mount default operating mode on startup and after control is returned from autopilot

MNT_JSTICK_SPD.Description: 0 for position control, small for low speeds, 100 for max speed. A good general value is 10 which gives a movement speed of 3 degrees per second.

MNT_LEAD_PTCH.Description: Causes the servo angle output to lead the current angle of the vehicle by some amount of time based on current angular rate. Increase until the servo is responsive but doesn't overshoot. Does nothing with pan stabilization enabled.

MNT_LEAD_RLL.Description: Causes the servo angle output to lead the current angle of the vehicle by some amount of time based on current angular rate, compensating for servo delay. Increase until the servo is responsive but doesn't overshoot. Does nothing with pan stabilization enabled.

MNT_NEUTRAL_X.DisplayName: Mount roll angle when in neutral position
MNT_NEUTRAL_X.Description: Mount roll angle when in neutral position

MNT_NEUTRAL_Y.DisplayName: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in neutral position
MNT_NEUTRAL_Y.Description: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in neutral position

MNT_NEUTRAL_Z.DisplayName: Mount pan/yaw angle when in neutral position
MNT_NEUTRAL_Z.Description: Mount pan/yaw angle when in neutral position

MNT_RC_IN_PAN.Description: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control pan (yaw) movements

MNT_RC_IN_ROLL.Description: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control roll movements

MNT_RC_IN_TILT.Description: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control tilt (pitch) movements

MNT_RETRACT_X.DisplayName: Mount roll angle when in retracted position
MNT_RETRACT_X.Description: Mount roll angle when in retracted position

MNT_RETRACT_Y.DisplayName: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in retracted position
MNT_RETRACT_Y.Description: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in retracted position

MNT_RETRACT_Z.DisplayName: Mount yaw/pan angle when in retracted position
MNT_RETRACT_Z.Description: Mount yaw/pan angle when in retracted position

MNT_STAB_PAN.Description: enable pan/yaw stabilisation relative to Earth

MNT_STAB_ROLL.Description: enable roll stabilisation relative to Earth

MNT_STAB_TILT.Description: enable tilt/pitch stabilisation relative to Earth

MNT2_ANGMAX_PAN.Description: MOunt2's maximum physical pan (yaw) angular position

MNT2_ANGMAX_ROL.Description: Mount2's maximum physical roll angular position

MNT2_ANGMAX_TIL.Description: Mount2's maximum physical tilt (pitch) angular position

MNT2_ANGMIN_PAN.Description: Mount2's minimum physical pan (yaw) angular position

MNT2_ANGMIN_ROL.Description: Mount2's minimum physical roll angular position

MNT2_ANGMIN_TIL.Description: Mount2's minimum physical tilt (pitch) angular position

MNT2_DEFLT_MODE.Description: Mount default operating mode on startup and after control is returned from autopilot

MNT2_LEAD_PTCH.Description: Causes the servo angle output to lead the current angle of the vehicle by some amount of time based on current angular rate. Increase until the servo is responsive but doesn't overshoot. Does nothing with pan stabilization enabled.

MNT2_LEAD_RLL.Description: Causes the servo angle output to lead the current angle of the vehicle by some amount of time based on current angular rate, compensating for servo delay. Increase until the servo is responsive but doesn't overshoot. Does nothing with pan stabilization enabled.

MNT2_NEUTRAL_X.DisplayName: Mount2 roll angle when in neutral position
MNT2_NEUTRAL_X.Description: Mount2 roll angle when in neutral position

MNT2_NEUTRAL_Y.DisplayName: Mount2 tilt/pitch angle when in neutral position
MNT2_NEUTRAL_Y.Description: Mount2 tilt/pitch angle when in neutral position

MNT2_NEUTRAL_Z.DisplayName: Mount2 pan/yaw angle when in neutral position
MNT2_NEUTRAL_Z.Description: Mount2 pan/yaw angle when in neutral position

MNT2_RC_IN_PAN.Description: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control pan (yaw) movements

MNT2_RC_IN_ROLL.Description: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control roll movements

MNT2_RC_IN_TILT.Description: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control tilt (pitch) movements

MNT2_RETRACT_X.DisplayName: Mount2 roll angle when in retracted position
MNT2_RETRACT_X.Description: Mount2 roll angle when in retracted position

MNT2_RETRACT_Y.DisplayName: Mount2 tilt/pitch angle when in retracted position
MNT2_RETRACT_Y.Description: Mount2 tilt/pitch angle when in retracted position

MNT2_RETRACT_Z.DisplayName: Mount2 yaw/pan angle when in retracted position
MNT2_RETRACT_Z.Description: Mount2 yaw/pan angle when in retracted position

MNT2_STAB_PAN.Description: enable pan/yaw stabilisation relative to Earth

MNT2_STAB_ROLL.Description: enable roll stabilisation relative to Earth

MNT2_STAB_TILT.Description: enable tilt/pitch stabilisation relative to Earth

MOT_1_DIRECTION.Description: Used to change motor rotation directions without changing wires

MOT_2_DIRECTION.Description: Used to change motor rotation directions without changing wires

MOT_3_DIRECTION.Description: Used to change motor rotation directions without changing wires

MOT_4_DIRECTION.Description: Used to change motor rotation directions without changing wires

MOT_5_DIRECTION.Description: Used to change motor rotation directions without changing wires

MOT_6_DIRECTION.Description: Used to change motor rotation directions without changing wires

MOT_7_DIRECTION.Description: Used to change motor rotation directions without changing wires

MOT_8_DIRECTION.Description: Used to change motor rotation directions without changing wires

MOT_BAT_CURR_MAX.Description: Maximum current over which maximum throttle is limited (0 = Disabled)
Maximum current over which maximum throttle is limited (0 = Disabled)

MOT_BAT_CURR_TC.Description: Time constant used to limit the maximum current
Time constant used to limit the maximum current

MOT_BAT_VOLT_MAX.Description: Battery voltage compensation maximum voltage (voltage above this will have no additional scaling effect on thrust). Recommend 4.4 * cell count, 0 = Disabled
Battery voltage compensation maximum voltage (voltage above this will have no additional scaling effect on thrust). Recommend 4.4 * cell count, 0 = Disabled

MOT_BAT_VOLT_MIN.Description: Battery voltage compensation minimum voltage (voltage below this will have no additional scaling effect on thrust). Recommend 3.5 * cell count, 0 = Disabled
Battery voltage compensation minimum voltage (voltage below this will have no additional scaling effect on thrust). Recommend 3.5 * cell count, 0 = Disabled

MOT_FV_CPLNG_K.Description: Used to decouple pitch from forward/vertical motion. 0 to disable, 1.2 normal

MOT_HOVER_LEARN.Description: Enable/Disable automatic learning of hover throttle
Enable/Disable automatic learning of hover throttle

MOT_PWM_MAX.Description: This sets the max PWM value that will ever be output to the motors, 0 = use input RC3_MAX
This sets the max PWM value that will ever be output to the motors, 0 = use input RC3_MAX

MOT_PWM_MIN.Description: This sets the min PWM output value that will ever be output to the motors, 0 = use input RC3_MIN
This sets the min PWM output value that will ever be output to the motors, 0 = use input RC3_MIN

MOT_PWM_TYPE.Description: This selects the output PWM type, allowing for normal PWM continuous output, OneShot or brushed motor output
This selects the output PWM type, allowing for normal PWM continuous output, OneShot or brushed motor output

MOT_SAFE_DISARM.DisplayName: Motor PWM output disabled when disarmed
MOT_SAFE_DISARM.Description: Disables motor PWM output when disarmed
MOT_SAFE_DISARM.Values: 0:PWM enabled while disarmed, 1:PWM disabled while disarmed

MOT_SAFE_DISARM.DisplayName: Motor PWM output disabled when disarmed
MOT_SAFE_DISARM.Description: Disables motor PWM output when disarmed
MOT_SAFE_DISARM.Values: 0:PWM enabled while disarmed, 1:PWM disabled while disarmed

MOT_SPIN_ARM.Description: Point at which the motors start to spin expressed as a number from 0 to 1 in the entire output range. Should be lower than MOT_SPIN_MIN.
Point at which the motors start to spin expressed as a number from 0 to 1 in the entire output range. Should be lower than MOT_SPIN_MIN.

MOT_SPIN_MAX.Description: Point at which the thrust saturates expressed as a number from 0 to 1 in the entire output range
Point at which the thrust saturates expressed as a number from 0 to 1 in the entire output range

MOT_SPIN_MIN.Description: Point at which the thrust starts expressed as a number from 0 to 1 in the entire output range. Should be higher than MOT_SPIN_ARM.
Point at which the thrust starts expressed as a number from 0 to 1 in the entire output range. Should be higher than MOT_SPIN_ARM.

MOT_SPOOL_TIME.Description: Time in seconds to spool up the motors from zero to min throttle.
Time in seconds to spool up the motors from zero to min throttle.

MOT_THST_EXPO.Description: Motor thrust curve exponent (from 0 for linear to 1.0 for second order curve)
Motor thrust curve exponent (from 0 for linear to 1.0 for second order curve)

MOT_THST_HOVER.Description: Motor thrust needed to hover expressed as a number from 0 to 1
Motor thrust needed to hover expressed as a number from 0 to 1

MOT_YAW_HEADROOM.Description: Yaw control is given at least this pwm range
Yaw control is given at least this pwm range

NTF_BUZZ_ENABLE.Description: Enable or disable the buzzer. Only for Linux and PX4 based boards.

NTF_DISPLAY_TYPE.Description: This sets up the type of on-board I2C display. Disabled by default.

NTF_LED_BRIGHT.Description: Select the RGB LED brightness level. When USB is connected brightness will never be higher than low regardless of the setting.

NTF_LED_OVERRIDE.Description: This sets up the board RGB LED for override by MAVLink. Normal notify LED control is disabled

PILOT_ACCEL_Z.Description: The vertical acceleration used when pilot is controlling the altitude

PILOT_THR_FILT.Description: Throttle filter cutoff (Hz) - active whenever altitude control is inactive - 0 to disable

PILOT_VELZ_MAX.Description: The maximum vertical velocity the pilot may request in cm/s

POS_XY_P.Description: Loiter position controller P gain. Converts the distance (in the latitude direction) to the target location into a desired speed which is then passed to the loiter latitude rate controller

POS_Z_P.Description: Position (vertical) controller P gain. Converts the difference between the desired altitude and actual altitude into a climb or descent rate which is passed to the throttle rate controller

PRX_TYPE.Description: What type of proximity sensor is connected

PRX2_TYPE.Description: What type of proximity sensor is connected

PSC_ACC_XY_FILT.Description: Lower values will slow the response of the navigation controller and reduce twitchiness

RALLY_INCL_HOME.Description: Controls if Home is included as a Rally point (i.e. as a safe landing place) for RTL

RALLY_LIMIT_KM.Description: Maximum distance to rally point. If the closest rally point is more than this number of kilometers from the current position and the home location is closer than any of the rally points from the current position then do RTL to home rather than to the closest rally point. This prevents a leftover rally point from a different airfield being used accidentally. If this is set to 0 then the closest rally point is always used.

RALLY_TOTAL.Description: Number of rally points currently loaded

RC_FEEL_RP.Description: RC feel for roll/pitch which controls vehicle response to user input with 0 being extremely soft and 100 being crisp

RC_SPEED.Description: This is the speed in Hertz that your ESCs will receive updates

RC1_DZ.Description: dead zone around trim or bottom

RC1_MAX.Description: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

RC1_MIN.Description: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

RC1_REVERSED.Description: Reverse channel input. Set to 0 for normal operation. Set to 1 to reverse this input channel.

RC1_TRIM.Description: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.
