RC16_MAX.Description: RC最大PWM脉宽(微秒)。典型最小值1000，中点1500，最大值2000

RC16_MIN.Description: RC最小PWM脉冲宽度（以微秒计）。典型最小值1000，中点1500，最大值2000.

RC16_TRIM.Description: RC微调（中位）PWM脉冲宽度（以微秒计）。典型最小值1000，中点1500，最大值2000.

RC2_MAX.Description: RC最大PWM脉宽(微秒)。典型最小值1000，中点1500，最大值2000

RC2_MIN.Description: RC最小PWM脉冲宽度（以微秒计）。典型最小值1000，中点1500，最大值2000.

RC2_TRIM.Description: RC微调（中位）PWM脉冲宽度（以微秒计）。典型最小值1000，中点1500，最大值2000.

RC3_MAX.Description: RC最大PWM脉宽(微秒)。典型最小值1000，中点1500，最大值2000

RC3_MIN.Description: RC最小PWM脉冲宽度（以微秒计）。典型最小值1000，中点1500，最大值2000.

RC3_TRIM.Description: RC微调（中位）PWM脉冲宽度（以微秒计）。典型最小值1000，中点1500，最大值2000.

RC4_MAX.Description: RC最大PWM脉宽(微秒)。典型最小值1000，中点1500，最大值2000

RC4_MIN.Description: RC最小PWM脉冲宽度（以微秒计）。典型最小值1000，中点1500，最大值2000.

RC5_MIN.Description: RC最小PWM脉冲宽度（以微秒计）。典型最小值1000，中点1500，最大值2000.

RC7_MIN.Description: RC最小PWM脉冲宽度（以微秒计）。典型最小值1000，中点1500，最大值2000.

RC8_MAX.Description: RC最大PWM脉宽(微秒)。典型最小值1000，中点1500，最大值2000

RC8_MIN.Description: RC最小PWM脉冲宽度（以微秒计）。典型最小值1000，中点1500，最大值2000.

RC9_MAX.Description: RC最大PWM脉宽(微秒)。典型最小值1000，中点1500，最大值2000

RC9_MIN.Description: RC最小PWM脉冲宽度（以微秒计）。典型最小值1000，中点1500，最大值2000.

RCMAP_FORWARD.Description: 频道号码。这是有用的，当你有一个RC发射机，不能轻易改变频道顺序。转发通常在通道5上，但是您可以将其移动到具有此参数的任何通道。更改生效需要重新启动。

RCMAP_LATERAL.Description: 横向通道数量。这是有用的，当你有一个RC发射机，不能轻易改变频道顺序。横向通常是在通道6，但你可以移动它到任何通道与此参数。更改生效需要重新启动。

RCMAP_PITCH.Description: 俯仰通道号。此选项在你的遥控接收机无法随意更改通道时非常管用。通常俯仰对应于通道CH2，但仍可以通过此选项将其映射到任何一个其他通道。要使更改生效，需要重新启动。

RCMAP_ROLL.Description: 横滚通道号。此选项在你的遥控接收机无法随意更改通道时非常管用。通常横滚对应于通道CH1，但仍可以通过此选项将其映射到任何一个其他通道。要使更改生效，需要重新启动。

RCMAP_THROTTLE.Description: 油门通道号。此选项在你的遥控接收机无法随意更改通道时非常管用。通常油门对应于通道CH3，但仍可以通过此选项将其映射到任何一个其他通道。 APM 2.X警告：一旦接收机失联或者板载PPM编码器失效，改变油门通道会带来未知的失效保护后果。推荐禁用板载PPM编码器。

RCMAP_YAW.Description: 偏航通道号。此选项在你的遥控接收机无法随意更改通道时非常管用。通常航向对应于通道CH4，但仍可以通过此选项将其映射到任何一个其他通道。要使更改生效，需要重新启动。

RELAY_PIN.Description: 第一继电器引脚。这个引脚用于相机控制。
RELAY_PIN.Values: -1:Disabled,13:APM2 A9 pin,47:APM1 relay,49:BB Blue GP0 pin 4,50:Pixhawk AUXOUT1,51:Pixhawk AUXOUT2,52:Pixhawk AUXOUT3,53:Pixhawk AUXOUT4,54:Pixhawk AUXOUT5,55:Pixhawk AUXOUT6,57:BB Blue GP0 pin 3,111:PX4 FMU Relay1,112:PX4 FMU Relay2,113:PX4IO Relay1/BB Blue GP0 pin 6,114:PX4IO Relay2,115:PX4IO ACC1,116:PX4IO ACC2/BB Blue GP0 pin 5

RELAY_PIN2.Values: -1:Disabled,13:APM2 A9 pin,47:APM1 relay,49:BB Blue GP0 pin 4,50:Pixhawk AUXOUT1,51:Pixhawk AUXOUT2,52:Pixhawk AUXOUT3,53:Pixhawk AUXOUT4,54:Pixhawk AUXOUT5,55:Pixhawk AUXOUT6,57:BB Blue GP0 pin 3,111:PX4 FMU Relay1,112:PX4 FMU Relay2,113:PX4IO Relay1/BB Blue GP0 pin 6,114:PX4IO Relay2,115:PX4IO ACC1,116:PX4IO ACC2/BB Blue GP0 pin 5

RELAY_PIN3.Values: -1:Disabled,13:APM2 A9 pin,47:APM1 relay,49:BB Blue GP0 pin 4,50:Pixhawk AUXOUT1,51:Pixhawk AUXOUT2,52:Pixhawk AUXOUT3,53:Pixhawk AUXOUT4,54:Pixhawk AUXOUT5,55:Pixhawk AUXOUT6,57:BB Blue GP0 pin 3,111:PX4 FMU Relay1,112:PX4 FMU Relay2,113:PX4IO Relay1/BB Blue GP0 pin 6,114:PX4IO Relay2,115:PX4IO ACC1,116:PX4IO ACC2/BB Blue GP0 pin 5

RELAY_PIN4.Values: -1:Disabled,13:APM2 A9 pin,47:APM1 relay,49:BB Blue GP0 pin 4,50:Pixhawk AUXOUT1,51:Pixhawk AUXOUT2,52:Pixhawk AUXOUT3,53:Pixhawk AUXOUT4,54:Pixhawk AUXOUT5,55:Pixhawk AUXOUT6,57:BB Blue GP0 pin 3,111:PX4 FMU Relay1,112:PX4 FMU Relay2,113:PX4IO Relay1/BB Blue GP0 pin 6,114:PX4IO Relay2,115:PX4IO ACC1,116:PX4IO ACC2/BB Blue GP0 pin 5

RLL2SRV_D.Description: 这个参数控制了从横滚比率到副翼的增益。这个参数调节了横滚控制环的阻尼比。它有着旧PID控制器中的RLL2SRV_D一样的功能，但是消除了舵机抖动。这个增益因子有助于在紊流中减小横滚抖动。它应当以0.01的步长增加，因为过大的值会导致横滚方向高频振荡，有可能使得机架过度受压。

RLL2SRV_FF.Description: 这是对副翼输出的需求速率的增益。

RLL2SRV_I.Description: 参数控制了从倾角到副翼的增益。它有着旧PID控制器中的RLL2SRV_D一样的功能。增加这个增益会导致控制器由于飞机失去平衡而平衡掉稳定的偏移量。

RLL2SRV_IMAX.Description: 这个参数限制了副翼的度数（以厘米为单位），超过这个度数积分器就开始工作。在默认值设置为1500厘度时，积分器被限制在+-15度的舵机行程内，最大舵机偏转时+-45度，因此默认值表示了总行程的三分之一，这是比较合适的，除非飞行器严重配平失调

RLL2SRV_P.Description: 这是倾斜角误差对副翼的增益。

RLL2SRV_RMAX.Description: 这将设置控制器所要求的最大横滚比率(度/秒)。将其设置为零将取消限制。如果该值设置得太低，则飞行器将无法满足导航要求，飞机将开始S航线。如果设置得太高(或设置为零而禁用)，则副翼将在转动开始时获得很大输入。60度/秒是一个很好的默认限定值

RLL2SRV_TCONST.Description: 这个参数决定了从产生需求到获得对应的倾角所需时间。0.5是一个不错的默认值，基本适用于所有模型。高级用户也许会想要改小这个值以获得更快的响应，但是将它改得比设备的最小响应时间还小时没有任何意义的。

RNGFND_ADDR.Description: 在适用的情况下设置传感器的总线地址。用于LightWare I2C传感器，允许多个传感器在不同的地址。值为0将禁用传感器。

RNGFND_FUNCTION.Description: 控制用于计算距离的函数。对于线性函数，距离是(电压偏移)*缩放。对于倒置函数，距离是(偏移电压)*缩放。对于双曲函数，距离是标度/(电压偏移)。函数返回以米为单位。

RNGFND_GNDCLEAR.DisplayName: Distance (in cm) from the range finder to the ground
RNGFND_GNDCLEAR.Description: 此参数设置车辆在地面时测距仪应返回的预期距离(厘米)。

RNGFND_LANDING.Description: 启动测距仪自动着陆。测距仪将用于着陆方式和最终襟翼。

RNGFND_MAX_CM.Description: 测距仪能够可靠读出的最大距离，以厘米为单位

RNGFND_MIN_CM.Description: 测距仪能够可靠读出的最大距离，以厘米为单位

RNGFND_OFFSET.Description: 模拟测距仪零距离时的电压偏移量。为PWM和I2C Lidars增加厘米距离的偏移量

RNGFND_PIN.Description: 测距仪连接到的模拟引脚。设置这个参数为0-9来对应APM2的模拟引脚。使用APM1时设置为64，对应于板子末端的“空速计”接口。使用PX4时设为11对应于“空速计”接口。使用Pixhawk时设为15，对应于模拟“空速计”接口。

RNGFND_POS_X.Description: 第一个测距仪在机体内的X位置。X是原点的正方向。如果提供，使用零点范围基准点。

RNGFND_POS_Y.Description: 第一个测距仪在机体内的Y位置。Y是原点的正方向。如果提供，使用零点范围基准点。

RNGFND_POS_Z.Description: 第一个测距仪在机体内的Z位置。Z是原点的正方向。如果提供，使用零点范围基准点。

RNGFND_PWRRNG.Description: 此参数设置估计的地形距离(以米为单位)，传感器将置于省电模式(如果可用)。值为零表示没有启用省电功能

RNGFND_RMETRIC.Description: 此参数设置模拟测距仪是否为比例测距仪。大多数模拟测距仪都是比例测距仪，这意味着它们的输出电压受电源电压的影响。一些模拟测距仪(如SF/02)有自己的内部电压调节器，因此它们不是比例计量器。

RNGFND_SCALING.Description: 测距仪读数与距离的标度因子。对于线性函数和倒置函数，这是以米/伏特为单位。对于双曲函数，单位是米伏特。

RNGFND_SETTLE.Description: 以毫秒为单位的测距仪读数所需的时间。只有在指定Stop_PIN时才使用。它决定了在我们将Stop_PIN设置高之后，需要等待测距仪给出读数的时间。对于距离在7米左右的声纳测距仪来说，这需要50毫秒左右的时间才能让声纳脉冲再次到达目标并返回。

RNGFND_STOP_PIN.Description: 模拟测距仪启用/禁用测距仪测量的数字引脚。-1表示没有引脚。如果设置了该选项，则将引脚设置为1启用测距仪，将其设置为0禁用它。这可以用来确保多个声纳测距仪不会互相干扰。
RNGFND_STOP_PIN.Values: -1:Not Used,50:Pixhawk AUXOUT1,51:Pixhawk AUXOUT2,52:Pixhawk AUXOUT3,53:Pixhawk AUXOUT4,54:Pixhawk AUXOUT5,55:Pixhawk AUXOUT6,111:PX4 FMU Relay1,112:PX4 FMU Relay2,113:PX4IO Relay1,114:PX4IO Relay2,115:PX4IO ACC1,116:PX4IO ACC2

RNGFND_TYPE.Description: 连接的是什么类型的测距仪

RNGFND_WSP_AVG.Description: 设置要在多脉冲平均模式下使用的脉冲数。在这种模式下，取一系列快速发射范围的平均值，以提高测量的精度

RNGFND_WSP_FRQ.Description: 设置测距操作的重复频率，单位为赫兹。输入所需的频率后，系统将根据内部计时器的分辨率计算它能处理的最近频率。

RNGFND_WSP_MAVG.Description: 设置用于计算当前范围结果的历史范围结果的数目。当MAVG大于1时，当前范围的结果将是当前测量值与N-1先前结果的平均值

RNGFND_WSP_MEDF.Description: 设置实时中值筛选器的窗口大小。当MEDF大于0时，中值滤波是有效的

RNGFND_WSP_THR.Description: 设置系统灵敏度。THR值越大，灵敏度越高。系统可能会限制THR的最大值，以防止基于工厂设置的过高的误报率。为自动阈值调整设置为-1

RNGFND2_ADDR.Description: 这将设置传感器的总线地址(如适用)。用于光电I2C传感器，允许不同地址上的多个传感器。值0禁用传感器。

RNGFND2_FUNCTION.Description: 控制用于计算距离的函数。对于线性函数，距离是(电压偏移)*缩放。对于倒置函数，距离是(偏移电压)*缩放。对于双曲函数，距离是标度/(电压偏移)。函数以米为单位返回距离。

RNGFND2_GNDCLEAR.DisplayName: Distance (in cm) from the second range finder to the ground
RNGFND2_GNDCLEAR.Description: 此参数设置飞机在地面时第二测距仪应返回的预期距离(厘米)。

RNGFND2_MAX_CM.Description: 测距仪能够可靠读出的最大距离，以厘米为单位

RNGFND2_MIN_CM.Description: 测距仪能够靠读出的最小距离，以厘米为单位

RNGFND2_PIN.Description: 测距仪连接到的模拟引脚。设置这个参数为0-9来对应APM2的模拟引脚。使用APM1时设置为64，对应于板子末端的“空速计”接口。使用PX4时设为11对应于“空速计”接口。使用Pixhawk时设为15，对应于模拟“空速计”接口。

RNGFND2_POS_X.Description: 在机架中,第二测距仪X的位置。正X在原点的前面。如果提供的话，使用零范围基准点。

RNGFND2_POS_Y.Description: 在机架中,第二测距仪Y的位置。正数Y在原点的右边。如果提供的话，使用零范围基准点。

RNGFND2_POS_Z.Description: 在机架中,第二测距仪Z的位置。正Z从原点开始下降。如果提供的话，使用零范围基准点。

RNGFND2_RMETRIC.Description: 此参数设置模拟测距仪是否为比例测距仪。大多数模拟测距仪都是比例测距仪，这意味着它们的输出电压受电源电压的影响。一些模拟测距仪(如SF/02)有自己的内部电压调节器，因此它们不是比例计量器。

RNGFND2_SCALING.Description: 测距仪读数与距离的比例因子，对于线性函数和倒置函数，这是以米/伏特为单位。对于双曲函数，单位是米/伏特

RNGFND2_SETTLE.Description: 以毫秒为单位的测距仪读数所需的时间。只有在指定Stop_PIN时才使用。它决定了在我们将Stop_PIN设置高之后，需要等待测距仪给出读数的时间。对于距离在7米左右的声纳测距仪来说，这需要50毫秒左右的时间才能让声纳脉冲再次到达目标并返回。

RNGFND2_STOP_PIN.Description: 模拟测距仪启用/禁用测距仪测量的数字引脚。-1表示没有引脚。如果设置了该选项，则将引脚设置为1启用测距仪，将其设置为0禁用它。这可以用来确保多个声纳测距仪不会互相干扰。
RNGFND2_STOP_PIN.Values: -1:Not Used,50:Pixhawk AUXOUT1,51:Pixhawk AUXOUT2,52:Pixhawk AUXOUT3,53:Pixhawk AUXOUT4,54:Pixhawk AUXOUT5,55:Pixhawk AUXOUT6,111:PX4 FMU Relay1,112:PX4 FMU Relay2,113:PX4IO Relay1,114:PX4IO Relay2,115:PX4IO ACC1,116:PX4IO ACC2

RNGFND2_TYPE.Description: 连接的是什么类型的测距仪

RNGFND2_WSP_AVG.Description: 设置要在多脉冲平均模式下使用的脉冲数。在这种模式下，取一段快速发射范围的平均值，以提高测量的精度

RNGFND2_WSP_FRQ.Description: 设置测距操作的重复频率，单位为赫兹。输入所需的频率后，系统将根据内部计时器的分辨率计算它能处理的最近频率。

RNGFND2_WSP_MAVG.Description: 设置用于计算当前范围结果的历史范围结果的数目。当MAVG大于1时，当前范围的结果将是当前测量值与N-1先前结果的平均值

RNGFND2_WSP_MEDF.Description: 设置实时中值筛选器的窗口大小。当MEDF大于0时，中值滤波是有效的

RNGFND2_WSP_THR.Description: 设置系统灵敏度。THR值越大，灵敏度越高。系统可能会限制THR的最大值，以防止基于工厂设置的过高的误报率。为自动阈值调整设置为-1

RNGFND3_ADDR.Description: 在适用的情况下设置传感器的总线地址。用于LightWare I2C传感器，允许多个传感器在不同的地址。值为0将禁用传感器。

RNGFND3_FUNCTION.Description: 控制用于计算距离的函数。对于线性函数，距离是(电压偏移)*缩放。对于倒置函数，距离是(偏移电压)*缩放。对于双曲函数，距离是标度/(电压偏移)。函数返回以米为单位。

RNGFND3_GNDCLEAR.DisplayName: Distance (in cm) from the third range finder to the ground
RNGFND3_GNDCLEAR.Description: 这个参数设置了预期的距离测量(以厘米为单位)，当飞机在地面上时，第三个测距仪应该返回。

RNGFND3_MAX_CM.Description: 测距仪能够可靠读出的最大距离，以厘米为单位

RNGFND3_MIN_CM.Description: 测距仪能够可靠读出的最小距离，以厘米为单位

RNGFND3_PIN.Description: 测距仪连接到的模拟引脚。设置这个参数为0-9来对应APM2的模拟引脚。使用APM1时设置为64，对应于板子末端的“空速计”接口。使用PX4时设为11对应于“空速计”接口。使用Pixhawk时设为15，对应于模拟“空速计”接口。

RNGFND3_POS_X.Description: 在机架中,第二测距仪X的位置。正X在原点的前面。如果提供的话，使用零范围基准点。

RNGFND3_POS_Y.Description: 在机架中,第二测距仪Y的位置。正数Y在原点的右边。如果提供的话，使用零范围基准点。

RNGFND3_POS_Z.Description: 在机架中,第二测距仪Z的位置。正Z从原点开始下降。如果提供的话，使用零范围基准点。

RNGFND3_RMETRIC.Description: 此参数设置模拟测距仪是否为比例测距仪。大多数模拟测距仪都是比例测距仪，这意味着它们的输出电压受电源电压的影响。一些模拟测距仪(如SF/02)有自己的内部电压调节器，因此它们不是比率计量器。

RNGFND3_SCALING.Description: 测距仪读数与距离的比例因子，对于线性函数和倒置函数，这是以米/伏特为单位。对于双曲函数，单位是米/伏特

RNGFND3_SETTLE.Description: 以毫秒为单位的测距仪读数所需的时间。仅在指定Stop_PIN时使用。它决定了在我们将Stop_PIN设置高之后，需要等待测距仪给出读数的时间。对于距离在7米左右的声纳测距仪来说，这需要50毫秒左右的时间才能让声纳脉冲再次到达目标并返回。

RNGFND3_STOP_PIN.Description: 模拟测距仪启用/禁用测距仪测量的数字引脚。-1表示没有引脚。如果设置了该选项，则将引脚设置为1启用测距仪，将其设置为0禁用它。这可以用来确保多个声纳测距仪不会互相干扰。
RNGFND3_STOP_PIN.Values: -1:Not Used,50:Pixhawk AUXOUT1,51:Pixhawk AUXOUT2,52:Pixhawk AUXOUT3,53:Pixhawk AUXOUT4,54:Pixhawk AUXOUT5,55:Pixhawk AUXOUT6,111:PX4 FMU Relay1,112:PX4 FMU Relay2,113:PX4IO Relay1,114:PX4IO Relay2,115:PX4IO ACC1,116:PX4IO ACC2

RNGFND3_TYPE.Description: 连接的是什么类型的测距仪

RNGFND3_WSP_AVG.Description: 设置要在多脉冲平均模式下使用的脉冲数。在这种模式下，取一段快速发射范围的平均值，以提高测量的精度

RNGFND3_WSP_FRQ.Description: 设置测距操作的重复频率，单位为赫兹。输入所需的频率后，系统将根据内部计时器的分辨率计算它能处理的最近频率。

RNGFND3_WSP_MEDF.Description: 设置实时中值筛选器的窗口大小。当MEDF大于0时，中值滤波是有效的

RNGFND3_WSP_THR.Description: 设置系统灵敏度。THR值越大，灵敏度越高。系统可能会限制THR的最大值，以防止基于工厂设置的过高的误报率。为自动阈值调整设置为-1

RNGFND4_ADDR.Description: 在适用的情况下设置传感器的总线地址。用于LightWare I2C传感器，允许多个传感器在不同的地址。值为0将禁用传感器。

RNGFND4_FUNCTION.Description: 控制用于计算距离的函数。对于线性函数，距离是(电压偏移)*缩放。对于倒置函数，距离是(偏移电压)*缩放。对于双曲函数，距离是标度/(电压偏移)。函数返回以米为单位。

RNGFND4_GNDCLEAR.DisplayName: Distance (in cm) from the fourth range finder to the ground
RNGFND4_GNDCLEAR.Description: 这个参数设置了预期的距离测量(以厘米为单位)，当飞机在地面上时，第二个测距仪应该返回。

RNGFND4_MAX_CM.Description: 测距仪能够可靠读出的最大距离，以厘米为单位

RNGFND4_MIN_CM.Description: 测距仪能够可靠读出的最小距离，以厘米为单位

RNGFND4_PIN.Description: 测距仪连接到的模拟引脚。设置这个参数为0-9来对应APM2的模拟引脚。使用APM1时设置为64，对应于板子末端的“空速计”接口。使用PX4时设为11对应于“空速计”接口。使用Pixhawk时设为15，对应于模拟“空速计”接口。

RNGFND4_POS_X.Description: 在机架中,第四测距仪X位置。如果提供的话，使用零范围基准点。

RNGFND4_POS_Y.Description: 在机架中,第四测距仪Y位置。如果提供的话，使用零范围基准点。

RNGFND4_POS_Z.Description: 在机架中,第四测距仪Z位置。如果提供的话，使用零范围基准点。

RNGFND4_RMETRIC.Description: 此参数设置模拟测距仪是否为比例测距仪。大多数模拟测距仪都是比例测距仪，这意味着它们的输出电压受电源电压的影响。一些模拟测距仪(如SF/02)有自己的内部电压调节器，因此它们不是比例计量器。

RNGFND4_SCALING.Description: 测距仪读数与距离的标度因子。对于线性函数和倒置函数，这是以米/伏特为单位。对于双曲函数，单位是米伏特。

RNGFND4_SETTLE.Description: 以毫秒为单位的测距仪读数所需的时间。只有在指定Stop_PIN时才使用。它决定了在我们将Stop_PIN设置高之后，需要等待测距仪给出读数的时间。对于距离在7米左右的声纳测距仪来说，这需要50毫秒左右的时间才能让声纳脉冲再次到达目标并返回。

RNGFND4_STOP_PIN.Description: 模拟测距仪启用/禁用测距仪测量的数字引脚。-1表示没有引脚。如果设置了该选项，则将引脚设置为1启用测距仪，将其设置为0禁用它。这可以用来确保多个声纳测距仪不会互相干扰。
RNGFND4_STOP_PIN.Values: -1:Not Used,50:Pixhawk AUXOUT1,51:Pixhawk AUXOUT2,52:Pixhawk AUXOUT3,53:Pixhawk AUXOUT4,54:Pixhawk AUXOUT5,55:Pixhawk AUXOUT6,111:PX4 FMU Relay1,112:PX4 FMU Relay2,113:PX4IO Relay1,114:PX4IO Relay2,115:PX4IO ACC1,116:PX4IO ACC2

RNGFND4_TYPE.Description: 连接的是什么类型的测距仪

RNGFND4_WSP_AVG.Description: 设置要在多脉冲平均模式下使用的脉冲数。在这种模式下，取一系列快速发射范围的平均值，以提高测量的精度

RNGFND4_WSP_FRQ.Description: 设置测距操作的重复频率，单位为赫兹。输入所需的频率后，系统将根据内部计时器的分辨率计算它能处理的最近频率。

RNGFND4_WSP_MAVG.Description: 设置用于计算当前范围结果的历史范围结果的数目。当MAVG大于1时，当前范围的结果将是当前测量值与N-1先前结果的平均值

RNGFND4_WSP_MEDF.Description: 设置实时中值筛选器的窗口大小。当MEDF大于0时，中值滤波是有效的

RNGFND4_WSP_THR.Description: 设置系统灵敏度。THR值越大，灵敏度越高。系统可能会限制THR的最大值，以防止基于工厂设置的过高的误报率。为自动阈值调整设置为-1

RPM_SCALING.Description: 传感器读数与RPM之间的缩放因子。

RPM_TYPE.Description: 连接的是什么类型的RPM传感器

RPM2_SCALING.Description: 传感器读数与RPM之间的缩放因子。

RPM2_TYPE.Description: 连接的是什么类型的RPM传感器

RSSI_ANA_PIN.Description: 这将选择一个模拟引脚，接收器RSSI电压将被读取。
RSSI_ANA_PIN.Values: 0:APM2 A0,1:APM2 A1,13:APM2 A13,11:Pixracer,13:Pixhawk ADC4,14:Pixhawk ADC3,15:Pixhawk ADC6,103:Pixhawk SBUS,15:Pixhawk2 ADC

RSSI_CHAN_HIGH.Description: 这是以微秒为单位的PWM值，当信号强度最大时，无线电接收器将输入RSSI_CHANNEL。由于一些无线电接收器输出的值与您可能期望的相反，所以这并不一定比RSSI_CHAN_LOW更高。

RSSI_CHAN_LOW.Description: 这是以微秒为单位的PWM值，当信号强度最大时，无线电接收器将输入RSSI_CHANNEL。这是以微秒为单位的PWM值，当信号强度最弱时，无线电接收器将输入RSSI_CHANNEL。由于一些无线电接收器输出的值与您可能期望的相反，所以这并不一定比RSSI_CHAN_HIGH更低。 由于一些无线电接收器输出的值与您可能期望的相反，所以这并不一定比RSSI_CHAN_LOW更高。

RSSI_CHANNEL.Description: 将由无线电接收机(5及以上)输出RSSI的通道号。

RSSI_PIN_HIGH.Description: 这是当信号强度最大时，无线电接收器在RSSI_ANA_PIN上设置的电压值。由于一些无线电接收器输出的值与您可能期望的相反，所以这并不一定比RSSI_PIN_LOW更高。

RSSI_PIN_LOW.Description: 这是当信号强度最弱时，无线电接收器在RSSI_ANA_PIN上设置的电压值。由于一些无线电接收器输出的值与您可能期望的相反，所以这并不一定比RSSI_PIN_HIGH更低。

RSSI_TYPE.Description: 遥控接收机RSSI类型。如果您的无线接收器支持某种类型的RSSI，请将其设置在此处，然后设置其关联的RSSI_XXXXX参数（如果有的话）。

RST_MISSION_CH.Description: RC通道用于将任务重置到第一个路径点。当这个频道超过1750时，任务就被重置。设置RST_MISSION_CH为0为禁用

RST_SWITCH_CH.Description: 遥控频道用来在接收到信号后重置到最后飞行模式。

RTL_AUTOLAND.Description: 到达RTL位置后自动开始着陆顺序。这需要添加一个DO_LAND_START 任务项，作为着陆序列开始的标记。最近的着陆顺序将被选择到当前位置
RTL_AUTOLAND.Values: 0:Disable,1:Enable - go HOME then land,2:Enable - go directly to landing sequence

RTL_RADIUS.Description: RTL模式下设置盘旋圈的半径。如果为零，则使用WP_LOITER_RAD。如果半径为负值，则使用逆时针方向。如果为正数，则使用顺时针式游荡。

RUDD_DT_GAIN.Description: 获得从方向舵到差动推力的控制

RUDDER_ONLY.Description: 只用方向舵模式。方向舵控制姿态在姿态控制模式(如FBWA)。你应该设置发射机摇杆输入RCMAP_YAW通道(通常4频道)。应该连接到方向舵机RCMAP_YAW通道。注意自动地面控制会关闭在只有方向舵的飞机。你也应该KFF_RDDRMIX设置为1.0。您还需要设置YAW2SRV_DAMP偏航阻尼适当为你的飞机。YAW2SRV_DAMP值为0.5是一个很好的起点。

SCALING_SPEED.DisplayName: speed used for speed scaling calculations
SCALING_SPEED.Description: 用来计算地面速度的缩放的以米/秒计的空速。注意所有PID数值都会受这个参数影响。

SCHED_DEBUG.Description: 设为非零值来开启进度调试语句。当设为“显示延迟”时将在因CPU负载过重而导致任务滞后的情况发生时打印提示语句。当设为“显示超负荷”时将在任务进程超过最大允许时限时打印提示语句。

SCHED_LOOP_RATE.Description: 此参数控制主控制回路的频率(以赫兹计)。这只能由开发人员更改。此操作仅在重新启动时生效。超过400的数值被认为是高度实验性的

SERIAL0_BAUD.Description: USB控制台使用的波特率。APM2可以支持最高115的所有波特率，也可以支持500。PX4可以支持最高1500.如果你设置了一个APM2不能支持的波特率以至于无法连接板子，那么你需要重新下载一个不同设备的固件，这样就能初始化所有设置了。

SERIAL0_PROTOCOL.Description: 控制要在控制台上使用的协议。

SERIAL1_BAUD.Description: 在Telem1端口使用的波特率。APM2可以支持所有的baudrates，最多115个，也可以支持500个。PX4可以支持高达1500的速率。如果你设置了一个你不能在APM2上支持的速率，然后不能连接到你的板，你应该从不同的车辆类型加载固件。这会将所有参数重置为默认值。

SERIAL1_PROTOCOL.Description: .控制在数传1端口上使用的协议。 请注意，Frsky选项需要外部转换器硬件。有关详细信息，请参见维基百科。
SERIAL1_PROTOCOL.Values: -1:None, 1:MAVLink1, 2:MAVLink2, 3:Frsky D, 4:Frsky SPort, 5:GPS, 7:Alexmos Gimbal Serial, 8:SToRM32 Gimbal Serial, 9:Rangefinder, 10:FrSky SPort Passthrough (OpenTX), 11:Lidar360, 13:Beacon, 14:Volz servo out, 15:SBus servo out, 16:ESC Telemetry, 17:Devo Telemetry

SERIAL2_BAUD.Description: 用于数传2接口的波特率。APM2可以支持最高115的所有波特率，也可以支持500。PX4可以支持最高1500.如果你设置了一个APM2不能支持的波特率以至于无法连接板子，那么你需要重新下载一个不同设备的固件，这样就能初始化所有设置了

SERIAL2_PROTOCOL.Description: 控制在数传2端口上使用的协议。请注意，Frsky选项需要外部转换器硬件。有关详细信息，请参见维基百科。
SERIAL2_PROTOCOL.Values: -1:None, 1:MAVLink1, 2:MAVLink2, 3:Frsky D, 4:Frsky SPort, 5:GPS, 7:Alexmos Gimbal Serial, 8:SToRM32 Gimbal Serial, 9:Rangefinder, 10:FrSky SPort Passthrough (OpenTX), 11:Lidar360, 13:Beacon, 14:Volz servo out, 15:SBus servo out, 16:ESC Telemetry, 17:Devo Telemetry

SERIAL3_BAUD.Description: 用于串行3(GPS)的波特率。APM2可以支持最高115的所有波特率，也可以支持500。PX4可以支持最高1500.如果你设置了一个APM2不能支持的波特率以至于无法连接板子，那么你需要重新下载一个不同设备的固件，这样就能初始化所有设置了

SERVO_AUTO_TRIM.Description: 启动舵机自动归中。当飞机接近水平时，舵机将在稳定的飞行模式中倾斜。对舵机倾斜的更改将每10秒保存一次，并且在飞行期间一直保持

SERVO_BLH_AUTO.Description: 如果设置为1，则自动启用BLHeli pass-thru支持所有多轴电机。

SERVO_BLH_DEBUG.Description: 设置为1时，当blheli协议处于活动状态时，通过MAVLink启用详细调试输出。这可以用于诊断故障。

SERVO_BLH_MASK.Description: 启动BLHeli pass-thru通过伺服协议支持特定信道

SERVO_BLH_OTYPE.Description: 当设置为非零值时，它将覆盖SERVO_BLH_MASK提供的输出通道的输出类型。这可以用来启用DShot的输出不属于多翼电机组。

SERVO_BLH_PORT.Description: 这设置了用于blheli pass-thru的遥测端口

SERVO_BLH_TEST.Description: 将SERVO_BLH_TEST设置为电机编号，可以将BLHeli ESC协议的内部测试设置为对应的ESC。调试输出显示在USB控制台。

SERVO_BLH_TMOUT.Description: 这将以秒为单位设置BLHeli协议的不活动超时。如果此时没有收到任何数据包，则恢复正常的MAVLink操作。值0表示没有超时

SERVO_BLH_TRATE.Description: 这将设置从ESCs请求遥测的速率(Hz)。它是每ESC的速率。设置为0将禁用遥测请求

SERVO_RATE.Description: 设置所有输出的默认输出频率(以赫兹为单位)。

SERVO_SBUS_RATE.Description: 设置SBUS输出帧速率(以赫兹为单位)。

SERVO_VOLZ_MASK.Description: 对特定信号道启用Volz舵机协议

SERVO1_FUNCTION.Description: 分配给这个舵机的功能。禁用此选项（0）将设置该输出为自动任务控制或者Mavlink语句控制。设为任何其他值则开启对应的功能。

SERVO1_MAX.Description: PWM最大脉宽值（以微秒为单位).典型最小值1000，中点1500，最大值2000

SERVO1_MIN.Description: PWM最小脉宽值（以微秒为单位).典型最小值1000，中点1500，最大值2000

SERVO1_REVERSED.Description: 反向舵机工作。设置成0为正常操作。设置为1以反转此输出通道。

SERVO1_TRIM.Description: PWM倾斜脉宽值（以微秒为单位).典型最小值1000，中点1500，最大值2000

SOAR_ALT_CUTOFF.DisplayName: Maximum power altitude, relative to the home location

SOAR_ALT_MAX.DisplayName: Maximum soaring altitude, relative to the home location

SOAR_ALT_MIN.DisplayName: Minimum soaring altitude, relative to the home location

SOAR_DIST_AHEAD.Description: 到热中心距离的初始估计

SOAR_ENABLE.DisplayName: Is the soaring mode enabled or not

SOAR_ENABLE_CH.DisplayName: (Optional) RC channel that toggles the soaring controller on and off
SOAR_ENABLE_CH.Description: 切换飞行控制器。只有当SOAR_ENABLE设置为1且该参数设置为有效的非零通道号时，该参数才有作用。设置好后，当RC输入到指定通道大于或等于1700时，猛增将被激活。

SOAR_MIN_THML_S.Description: 花在加热上的时间最少

SOAR_Q1.Description: 增强过程中噪声的标准偏差

SOAR_Q2.Description: 处理位置和半径的噪声标准偏差

SOAR_R.Description: 测量中噪声的标准偏差

SOAR_VSPEED.Description: 上升速率触发发射速度

SR3_EXT_STAT.DisplayName: Extended status stream rate to ground station
SR3_EXT_STAT.Description: 向地面站扩展状态流速率

SR3_EXTRA1.DisplayName: Extra data type 1 stream rate to ground station
SR3_EXTRA1.Description: 附加数据类型1对地面站的流率

SR3_EXTRA2.DisplayName: Extra data type 2 stream rate to ground station
SR3_EXTRA2.Description: 附加数据类型2对地面站的流率

SR3_EXTRA3.DisplayName: Extra data type 3 stream rate to ground station
SR3_EXTRA3.Description: 附加数据类型3对地面站的流

SR3_PARAMS.DisplayName: Parameter stream rate to ground station

SR3_POSITION.DisplayName: Position stream rate to ground station

SR3_RAW_CTRL.DisplayName: Raw Control stream rate to ground station
SR3_RAW_CTRL.Description: 至地面站的原始控制流率。

SR3_RAW_SENS.Description: 原始传感器流到地面站的速率

SR3_RC_CHAN.DisplayName: RC Channel stream rate to ground station

STAB_PITCH_DOWN.Description: 这个参数控制在电传操纵A模式和自动调参模式下位于低油门时的俯角增量。当油门高于TRIM_THROTTLE时没有增量。低于TRIM_THROTTLE增量按照油门低于TRIM_THROTTLE的比例来增加，0油门时使用此参数指定最大增量。这个参数的意义在于电传操纵A模式下出于低油门状态时维持空速，例如在降落近进阶段（但却不依赖空速计的情况下）。2度对于大多数飞机都合适，然而对于阻力较大的飞机而言这个值需要适当增加。

STALL_PREVENTION.Description: 这控制失速预防技术的使用，包括低速横滚限制和转弯提高最低空速。这些限制是基于气动力系数的倾斜转弯。此选项依赖于正确设置的ARSPD_FBW_min值。请注意，如果您没有空速传感器，那么失速预防将使用基于地面速度的空速估计，以及从自动驾驶盘转弯的响应中获取的风速估计值。这个综合的空速估计可能是不准确的，因此，不应该假设没有空速传感器的失速预防是有效的。

STAT_RESET.Description: 自2016年1月1日起的秒(Unix epoch+1451606400)自重置(设置为0重置统计信息)

STAT_RUNTIME.Description: 自动驾驶仪总运行时间

STEER2SRV_D.Description: 这个参数调节控制环的阻尼比。这个增益有助于减少振动转向抖动。它应当以0.01的步长增加。因为过大的值会导致操纵上的高频振荡。有可能使得机体过度受压。

STEER2SRV_DRTFCT.Description: 在“减速速度”以上每增加m/s的速度时，方向轮的减速度。应设置使飞机在较高的速度下不转弯，机翼不打地。

STEER2SRV_DRTMIN.Description: 以最大速度限制方向盘最小角度的角度。即使它应该减速，但是在这个角度时它会停止减速。

STEER2SRV_DRTSPD.Description: 速度之后，最大程度的转向将开始下降。将此速度设置为飞机可以在方向最大角度控制转向而不让机翼横滚的最大速度。如果为0，则不减速。

STEER2SRV_FF.Description: 转向的前馈增益，这是已实现的转向率与应用转向的比率。1意味着飞机将以每秒45度的速度偏航，并在1米/秒的地速下完全转向偏转。

STEER2SRV_I.Description: 这个参数是操纵角度的积分增益。增加这个增益使得控制器通过微调消除因设备失调带来的稳态误差

STEER2SRV_IMAX.Description: 这个参数限制了升降舵的度数（以厘度为单位），超过这个度数积分器就开始工作。在默认设置为1500厘度时，积分器被限制在+-15度的舵机行程内。最大舵机偏转时+-45度，因此默认值表示总行程的三分之一，这是比较合适的，除非机体严重失调。

STEER2SRV_MINSPD.Description: 这是用于操控时预设的最小地速（米/秒）。设置最小的速率可以防止机体刚开始运动时发生振荡。仍然可以在低于这个值的时候驱动，但是操纵的相关计算都是基于这个最小速率完成的。

STEER2SRV_P.Description: 操控的比例器增益。这个值应当大致等于设备在低速，最大操控角的转弯直径

STEER2SRV_TCONST.Description: 这个参数控制从期望到实际操纵角度的时间（秒）。默认值0.75是一个不错的数，适用于大多数移动端。地面操控飞机需要更小的时间常数，对于地面操控的固定翼飞机来说0.5是一个推荐的值。数值0.75的意思是控制器将试图在0.75秒内修正任何在期望值和实际操纵角之间的偏移。高级用户也许会想要改小这个值以获得更快的响应，但是将它改得比设备的最小响应时间还小是没有任何意义的

STICK_MIXING.Description: 当启用时，它将把用户摇杆输入增加到自动模式的控制界面，允许用户在不改变模式的请况下参与一定的操控。有两种混控模式。设为1则使用“电传操控”(FBW)混控，如同FBWA模式一样控制。当你通常用ArduPlane 飞FBWA或FBWA模式时这是最保险的选择。设为2则使用直接混控，如同自稳模式一样。这将允许在自动模式下执行大幅度动作。

SYSID_ENFORCE.Description: 控制来自预期gcs系统ID以外的数据包是否将被接受。

SYSID_MYGCS.Description: 地面站在MAVLink协议中的识别码。不要改动这个值除非你想修改匹配的地面站。

SYSID_THISMAV.DisplayName: MAVLink system ID of this vehicle
SYSID_THISMAV.Description: 允许为飞机设置一个单独的MAVLink系统id，以将其与同一网络上的其他系统区分开来。

TECS_APPR_SMAX.DisplayName: Sink rate max for landing approach stage
TECS_APPR_SMAX.Description: 着陆阶段的下沉速率最大值。对于大角度的着陆，这个值需要设置很大，特别是当使用反向推力时。如果为0，则使用TECS_SINK_MAX.

TECS_CLMB_MAX.Description: 这是油门位于THR_MAX并且空速设在默认值时飞机能获得的最大爬升率。对于电动飞机，请确保这个值在飞行的整个过程中，电池电压产生下降后仍能到达。可以在悬停，返航和引导模式下发送一个+100m的高度变化命令来测试这个参数。如果爬升所需要的油门值接近THR_MAX并且飞机维持着空速，那么这个参数设置正确。如果空速开始跌落，则这个值设置的太高，如果在位置空速爬升时所需的油门显著低于THR_MAX，那么要么增加CLMB_MAX，要么减少 THR_MAX

TECS_HGT_OMEGA.Description: 这是融合垂直加速度和气压计高度数据的补偿滤波器的交越频率，以获得高度比率和高度的估计。

TECS_INTEG_GAIN.Description: 这是控制环上的积分器增益。增加此值，以提高速度和高度偏移被削减的速度。

TECS_LAND_ARSPD.Description: 执行自主降落时，此值用作进场时的目标空速。注意，如果你的平台没有配备空速计这个参数无效（请改用TECS_LAND_THR）。若设置为负值，则降落中不使用。

TECS_LAND_DAMP.DisplayName: Controller sink rate to pitch gain during flare
TECS_LAND_DAMP.Description: 这是在飞行的最后着陆阶段俯仰需求回路的下沉率增益。它应该比TECS_PTCH_DAMP更大，以便在机翼期间更好地控制沉降速率。

TECS_LAND_IGAIN.Description: 这是在着陆时控制回路上的积分器增益。当设置为0时，则使用TECS_INTEG_GAIN增益。增加以增加速度和高度偏移被削减的速度。通常低于TECs_INTEG_GAIN的值最好

TECS_LAND_PDAMP.Description: 这是着陆时俯仰需求环的阻尼增益。增加阻尼以修正速度和高度的振荡。如果设置为0，则使用TECS_PTCH_DAMP。

TECS_LAND_PMAX.DisplayName: Maximum pitch during final stage of landing
TECS_LAND_PMAX.Description: 这限制了在自动着陆的最后阶段使用的俯仰。在最后的着陆阶段，大多数飞机需要保持它们的间距很小，以避免失速。最大设置为10度是不错的选择。零的值意味着使用正常的俯仰限制。

TECS_LAND_SINK.DisplayName: Sink rate for final landing stage
TECS_LAND_SINK.Description: 最终降落阶段以米/秒计的下滑速率

TECS_LAND_SPDWGT.DisplayName: Weighting applied to speed control during landing.
TECS_LAND_SPDWGT.Description: 与SPDWEIGHT参数类似，只不过这个参数在降落阶段生效。接近2的值将使得飞机在降落过程中无视高度误差。经验告诉我们这种情况下飞机将会抬头--某些情况下有利于滑降（副作用是飞机很可能越过接地线）。接近0的值将使得飞机在降落过程中无视速度误差--修改这个值小于1时要小心--因为无视速度误差有可能导致失速。0到2之间的值是固定着陆重量的有效值。当为-1时，重量将在着陆时进行缩放。在着陆开始时，它从TECS_SPDWEIGHT开始，在到达陆地点时缩小到0。示例：在着陆的中途，您将得到TECS_SPDWEIGHT/2的权重。

TECS_LAND_SRC.Description: 当设为0时，襟翼的下沉速率(TECS_LAND_SINK)是固定的下沉需求。当你得到超过LAND的航点在此基础上，启动襟翼下沉率将增加/减少襟翼下沉需求。在航点之前没有效果。此值被添加到TECS_LAND_SINK 接收器与wp后移动的距离成正比。随着下沉速率的增加，如果飞得太快，巡航超过着陆地点，你仍然可以在一定的距离内着陆。一个正的数值会迫使飞机更快地着陆，与超过着陆地点的距离成正比。负数将使飞机缓慢爬升，以进行俯仰失速着陆。建议0.2作为初始值。

TECS_LAND_TCONST.Description: 这是TECS控制算法在飞行最后着陆阶段的时间常数。应小于TECS_TIME_CONST以允许更快的襟翼

TECS_LAND_TDAMP.Description: 这是油门控制环在自动着陆过程中的阻尼增益。和TECS_THR_THR一样，但只有在飞机着陆时才有效.增加阻尼以纠正速度和高度的振荡。当设置为0时，油门阻尼由TECS_THR_DEAM控制。

TECS_LAND_THR.Description: 如果你的飞机没有空速传感器，请使用此参数替代LAND_ARSPD。它是降落进场时的巡航油门。如果此值为负，则它被禁用，TECS_LAND_ARSPD被使用。

TECS_PITCH_MAX.Description: 如果你的飞机没有空速传感器，请使用此参数替代LAND_ARSPD。它是降落进场时的巡航油门。如果此值为负，则它被禁用，TECS_LAND_ARSPD被使用。

TECS_PITCH_MIN.Description: 这个参数控制自动油门模式下的最大俯仰角。如果这个值设为0，则使用LIM_PITCH_MAX替代。设置这个参数的目的是为了在自动模式下使用比FBWA 模式下更小的俯仰范围。注意，TECS_PITCH_MIN应为负值r。

TECS_PTCH_DAMP.Description: 这个参数控制自动油门模式下的最大俯仰角。如果这个值设为0，则使用LIM_PITCH_MAX替代。设置这个参数的目的是为了在自动模式下使用比FBWA 模式下更小的俯仰范围。注意，TECS_PITCH_MIN应为负值r。

TECS_RLL2THR.Description: 增加这个增益因子将会增加在转向时需要的油门。用来补偿转弯时附加的阻力。理想情况下这个值大约是在45度倾侧转弯时产生的附加下滑速率（单位：m/s）的10倍。如果飞机在转弯初期损失速度，增加这个值；如果飞机在转弯初期获得速度，减少这个值；高效的高展弦飞机（例如带动力的滑翔机）可以将这个值调小一些，然而低效的低展弦飞机（例如三角翼）可以将这个值调大一些。

TECS_SINK_MAX.Description: 这个值设置控制器的最大下降率。若这个值太大，飞机将会先达到俯角上限。因此这个下降率值必须设成在飞机达到俯角上限之前能够获得。

TECS_SINK_MIN.Description: 这是当油门位于THR_MIN 时飞机的下滑速率，空速和测量CLMB_MAX时保持一致。

TECS_SPD_OMEGA.Description: 这是融合纵向加速度和空速数据的补偿滤波器的交越频率，以获得低噪声迟滞的空速估计。

TECS_SPDWEIGHT.Description: 此参数调整俯仰控制应用于速度与高度误差的权重。将其设置为0.0将导致俯仰控制来控制高度和忽略速度错误。这通常会提高高度精度，但给予较大的空速误差。将其设置为2.0将导致俯仰控制循环控制速度和忽略高度错误。这通常会减少空速误差，但给予较大的高度误差。值1.0给出了一个平衡的响应，这是默认值。

TECS_SYNAIRSPEED.DisplayName: Enable the use of synthetic airspeed
TECS_SYNAIRSPEED.Description: 这使得没有真正的空速传感器的飞机可以使用合成空速。这对于开发测试非常有用，因为在开发测试中，用户会意识到合成空速系统的相当大的局限性，例如当风的估计不准确时，会出现非常糟糕的估计。不要启用此选项，除非您完全了解合成空速估计的局限性。

TECS_THR_DAMP.Description: 这是油门控制环的阻尼增益。增加阻尼以纠正速度和高度的振荡。

TECS_TIME_CONST.Description: 这是TECS控制算法的时间常数。较小的值使响应更快，较大的值使响应更慢。

TECS_TKOFF_IGAIN.Description: 这是在起飞过程中控制环上的积分器增益。当设置为0时，则使用TECS_INTEG_GAIN 增益。增加以增加速度和高度偏移被削减的速度。通常高于TECS_INTEG_GRAGER值最佳

TECS_VERT_ACC.Description: 这是控制器将用来纠正速度或高度误差的最大垂直加速度。

TELEM_DELAY.Description: 延迟无线电遥测以防止XBee断电的时间(以秒为单位)

TERRAIN_ENABLE.Description: 使地形数据。这使得车辆能够在SD卡上存储地形数据数据库。地形数据根据需要从地面站请求，并存储在SD卡上供以后使用。为了发挥作用，地面站必须支持TERRAIN_REQUEST消息，并能够访问地形数据库，例如SRTM数据库。

TERRAIN_FOLLOW.Description: 这个参数开启巡航，FBWB，RLT和接力点模式下的地形跟踪。你需要设置TERRAIN_ENABLE为1来使用这个功能，以启用地面站获得的地形数据，且你必须拥有一个可以向飞机发送地形数据的地面站。当地形跟踪开启后巡航和FBWB模式下飞机将维持相对地形的高度而不是相对家的高度。返航时的返航高度也是相对于地形计算的。接力点高度也是这样。这个选项不影响自动任务的条目，只不过是在每一个航点里设置一个标志位，来决定它是相对于家高还是相对于地形。要做到这一点你需要一个能够设置航点地形高度的地面站软件

TERRAIN_LOOKAHD.Description: 这个参数控制地形跟踪代码先前看得距离。以确保飞行器能够始终保持在前方来临的地形上方。设为0代表没有预判，则飞控只会跟踪飞机目前位置下方的地形。自动任务模式下地形预判不会比下一个航点更远。

TERRAIN_SPACING.Description: 地形网格之间的距离。这控制了地面站获取并存储在SD卡上的地形数据的水平分辨率。如果你的地面站使用了世界范围的SRTM数据库则这个值为100米比较合适。有些地区也有更高分辨率的数据支持，例如美国支持30米距离分辨率的SRTM。这个参数同时控制了飞行中可存贮的数据量。较大的网格空间允许有更大的数据存储空间剩余。100米的网格空间将使得飞行器在存储器中保存12块网格数据，每一块约为2.7*3.2平方公里。一旦有其他从地面站下载的网格块就将存储到SD卡上。

THR_FAILSAFE.Description: 油门故障安全允许您配置一个在油门输入通道上的软件失效保护。

THR_FS_VALUE.Description: 通道3上的一个PWM值。低于这个值就会触发油门失效保护

THR_MAX.Description: 自驾仪使用的最大油门百分比

THR_MIN.Description: 自驾仪使用的最小油门百分比。对自动降落最终阶段这个值总是设为0.如果ESC支持反向，请使用负值来配置反向推力。

THR_PASS_STAB.Description: 如果设置了这个参数在自稳，FBWA 或 ACRO模式下油门数值直接从接收机映射到输出。这意味着THR_MIN 和 THR_MAX设置在这些模式下不被使用，对于汽油机来讲这很有用，可以设置一个油门截断开关来压制油门低于寻常最小值。

THR_SLEWRATE.Description: 油门1秒内的最大变化百分比。数值10意味着1秒内油门变化量不会超过全油门的10%。请注意，最小的油门变化是1微秒每环，这提供了一个较低的限制油门回转率，特别是在quadplanes运行300圈每秒默认。

THR_SUPP_MAN.Description: 自动模式下油门被压制时它一般被强制为0油门。若启用此项，则在压制阶段油门转为手动控制。对于汽油机来讲这很有用，可以在起飞等待阶段依靠手动来获得合适的油门输出。

THROTTLE_NUDGE.Description: 启用此项将使用自动油门模式下的油门输入来“轻推”油门或空速。当你安装空速计后轻推效应影响目标空速，因此超过50%的油门将增加目标空速。从TRIM_ARSPD_CM 直至ARSPD_FBW_MAX。若没有启动空速计则油门轻推仅在油门输入高于50%时推高目标油门值。

TKOFF_FLAP_PCNT.Description: 在自动起飞中应用的襟翼数量(百分比)

TKOFF_PLIM_SEC.Description: 此参数在自动起飞到达目标高度前的几秒钟内降低了自动起飞的偏航最小限值。这减少了超调，允许飞行控制器在到达目标高度前几秒钟开始调平。当设置为零时，任务的俯仰最小值在到达和通过目标高度的所有过程中都会被强制执行，否则，在最后一段中，俯仰最小值会慢慢降低到零。这是pitch_min，不是需求的。飞行控制器仍应控制飞行高度以完成起飞，但这种飞行控制方式并没有迫使它比想要的更高。

TKOFF_ROTATE_SPD.Description: 此参数在自动起飞到达目标高度前的几秒钟内降低了自动起飞的偏航最小限值。这减少了超调，允许飞行控制器在到达目标高度前几秒钟开始调平。当设置为零时，任务的俯仰最小值在到达和通过目标高度的所有过程中都会被强制执行，否则，在最后一段中，俯仰最小值会慢慢降低到零。这是pitch_min，不是需求的。飞行控制器仍应控制飞行高度以完成起飞，但这种飞行控制方式并没有迫使它比想要的更高。

TKOFF_TDRAG_ELEV.Description: 这个参数控制起飞初期阶段施加的升降舵量。这是用来让尾拖机的尾轮在起飞初期保持接地，以实现最大限度操控。这个选项应该和TKOFF_TDRAG_SPD1 和GROUND_STEER_ALT结合起来，并相应调节地面操纵控制器。设为0代表不执行起飞初期的“尾轮保持”。弹射起飞和手抛起飞可以设为0.对于尾拖机一般这个值设为100，代表着起飞初期阶段的满升舵，对于大多数前三点式起落架飞机，0值效果不错；但一些前三点式起落架飞机，一个小负数（例如-20到-300)将会施加压头力使得飞机在起飞加速阶段前轮抓地。仅在你发现前轮无法在起飞阶段抓地时才设为负值。前三点式起落架飞机如果有过多的压头力可能会导致操控不稳定，因为飞机倾向于以前轮为支点晃动。调节时每次增加10%的压头力。

TKOFF_TDRAG_SPD1.Description: 这个参数设定一个空速，在这个空速下飞机不再维持机尾触地，转而以方向舵控制飞机走向。当达到TKOFF_TDRAG_SPD1速度时，飞机的俯仰将保持水平，直到达到TKOFF_TDRAG_SPD1速度，这时由任务指定的俯仰角将会“抬轮”以便爬升。设置TKOFF_TDRAG_SPD1来略过此阶段直接抬轮。弹射起飞和抛起飞这项应设为0.对于前三点式飞机，这一项也应为0.对于尾拖机这个值应当刚好设在小于失速速度的时候

TKOFF_THR_DELAY.Description: 此参数设置由TKOFF_THR_MINACC控制的前向加速度检查通过后，执行地速检查前的延迟时间(以0.1秒为单位)。对于手抛起飞的飞机，必须将其设置为不少于2(0.2秒)，以确保飞机在飞机在电机转动前安全脱手。对于弹射式起飞，可以使用更大的值(例如30)来给出时间让弹射在发动机启动前从飞机上释放出来。

TKOFF_THR_MAX.Description: 自动起飞阶段的最大油门。若设为0则 THR_MAX 也被用来辅助起飞。

TKOFF_THR_MINACC.Description: 自动起飞模式下由速度检测环节得到的最小前向加速度为m/s/s。这用于手抛起飞情形。设为0禁用加速度测试，意味着地速检查条件始终成立，可能导致GPS速度跳变而意外启动电机。对于手抛起飞这个值应当设为15.

TKOFF_THR_MINSPD.Description: 由速度检测环节测到的最小GPS地速，用于在自动起飞环节释放油门压制。这个用于弹射起飞的情形，例如你只希望电机在飞机弹射出去以后才启动，然而建议使用TKOFF_THR_MINACC 和 TKOFF_THR_DELAY参数用于弹射起飞，因为GPS测量地速存在一定误差。对于手抛起飞的后推式飞机，强烈建议设置这个值不大于4m/s以防止电机意外启动。注意GPS速度一般滞后于实际速度半秒钟。地速检测由 TKOFF_THR_DELAY 控制延迟。

TKOFF_THR_SLEW.Description: 这个参数设置自动起飞模式下油门的斜率。设为0，则在起飞时使用 THR_SLEWRATE参数。对于滑跑起飞，宜设一个较小的斜率来实现平稳加速，保持良好的操控性。这个值时每秒钟油门的变化百分比，换言之20意味着起飞阶段油门从0-100需要经过5秒。低于20的数值并不推荐，因为这可能导致飞机试图以一个较小的油门值爬升。

TRIM_ARSPD_CM.Description: 自动模式下开启空速计后，以厘米/秒计的目标空速。这是一个校准后空速。

TRIM_AUTO.Description: 当从手动模式切出时设置遥控中位点为当前的PWM值。当开启此项时。一旦你从手动模式切到其他模式，APM会记下这个时刻的副翼/升降/方向舵的PWM数值作为对应通道的中立点。它将会使用这些值来设置SERVOn_TRIM 与 the RCn_TRIM。默认情况下这个选项是禁用的，以防止飞行员没有意识到此功能而从手动模式切出，却同时对应着非中立输入，造成严重的失调。你可以开启此选项来辅助配平你的飞机，起飞前开启这个选项，然后在飞行中暂时切换到手动，观察飞机的表现。然后可以切回到FBWM模式，微调各个舵面以后再测试手动模式。如此往复，每一次你从手动模式切出APM都会记录当前的中位点。当调节妥善以后你的飞机就可以关掉这个选项。

TRIM_PITCH_CD.Description: 加入俯仰角的偏移值--用于飞行中的俯仰微调。建议在地面调试时仔细放平飞机，而不是使用这个选项来获得良好飞行姿态。

TRIM_THROTTLE.Description: 普通飞行中油门的目标百分比

TUNE_CHAN.Description: 设置发射机调谐的通道。这应该连接到你的发射机上的一个旋钮或滑块。需要设置使用TUT_CHAN_MIN给出的PWM范围来调整_CHAN_MAX

TUNE_CHAN_MAX.Description: 这设置调谐通道的PWM上限

TUNE_CHAN_MIN.Description: 这设置调谐通道的PWM下限

TUNE_ERR_THRESH.Description: 设置控制器错误阈值，超过此阈值将发出警报，并消息发送给GCS，以警告控制器不稳定。

TUNE_MODE_REVERT.Description: 控制调优值是否会在飞行模式更改时恢复。

TUNE_PARAM.DisplayName: Transmitter tuning parameter or set of parameters
TUNE_PARAM.Description: 设置哪些参数或参数集将被调优。大于100的值表示一组参数，而不是单个参数。参数小于50只适用于QuadPlane的电机。

TUNE_RANGE.Description: 设置调优将更改参数的范围。2表示调优参数将从起始值的0.5倍增加到调谐通道范围内起始值的2倍。

TUNE_SELECTOR.Description: 设置发射机调谐选择器开关的通道。这应该是一个2段开关，最好是弹簧开关。PWM高于1700表示高，低于1300表示低。如果没有设置选择器，那么在飞行期间您将无法在参数之间切换或调整旋钮的中心位置。

USE_REV_THRUST.DisplayName: Bitmask for when to allow negative reverse thrust
USE_REV_THRUST.Description: 这参数控制何时使用反向推力。如果设置为零，则不使用反向推力。如果设置为非零值，则位数对应的是可以使用反向推力的飞行阶段。注意这种反向推力只有在自动油门模式下才能自动实现.在这个模式下，推力调节（throttle control）先导控制反向推力，而反向推力是由油门杆输入控制的。方向推力（USE_REV_THRUST）最常用的数值是2，它意味着只允许自动着陆（AUTO_LAND）。它可以在自动模式的着陆阶段启用反向推力。另一个常见的数值选择是1，它意味着在全部的自动飞行阶段使用反向推力。

WP_LOITER_RAD.Description: 定义离开航点的中心距离，飞机在悬停模式下保持这个距离。正值对应于顺势针盘旋，负值对应于逆时针盘旋。

WP_MAX_RADIUS.Description: 定义离开航点的距离的最大值，飞行器到达该距离时判定航点已到达。这将取代“越过航线”逻辑，对于普通的自动模式，这个参数应设为0.使用非零值仅在飞行器确实能飞进这个圈内，不会无限绕圈的苛刻情况下使用。当飞行器的自身转弯半径大于航点半径最大值时，这个参数可能会导致飞行器无限绕圈。

WP_RADIUS.Description: 这个参数定义了离航点的最大距离，当飞行器到达该距离时判定航点已到达。为了避免飞机绕着航点周围绕圈导致始终碰不到航点，一项额外的检查可以用于判断飞行器是否已经越过“终点线”，终点线是一条穿过航点线且与航线垂直的线，如果越过了终点线，就认为航点已到达。请注意，导航控制器可能会根据转弯的尖锐程度和飞机的速度，决定在航路点之前晚于WP_RADIUS转弯。请注意，导航控制器可能会根据转弯的尖锐程度和飞机的速度，决定在路径点之前晚于WP_RADIUS转弯。将WP_半径设置为比飞机通常的转弯半径大得多是安全的，导航控制器将确定何时转弯。如果你把WP_RADIUS设得太小，就很可能会过度转弯。

YAW2SRV_DAMP.Description: 这是从偏航率到舵的增益。它对偏航运动起着减震器的作用。如果需要基本的偏航阻尼器，可以增加这个增益项，同时使YAW2SRV_SLIP和YAW2SRV_int为零增益。注意区别与标准PID控制器的不同，如果这个阻尼项为零，那么积分器也将失效。

YAW2SRV_IMAX.Description: 这个参数控制了升级舵的度数，超过这个度数积分器就开始工作。在默认值为1500厘度时，积分器被限制在+-15度的舵机行程内，最大的舵机偏转时+-45度，因此默认值表示总行程的三分之一，这是比较合适的，除非飞行器严重配平失调或者方向舵效率严重低下

YAW2SRV_INT.Description: 这个参数是横向加速度误差的积分增益，除非需要主动式侧飘控制否则它应当设为0.若需要主动控制侧飘，可以以1.0作为初试值

YAW2SRV_RLL.Description: 这个增益项被应用在需要计算得出的偏航比率偏移上，以使偏航率与转向比率一致，实现协调转向。默认值1适用于所有模型。高级用户可以使用它来改变转向建立时偏向弯心或者外弯的趋势。增加这个值使得模型在转向起初时有更大的偏航。减小这个值使得模型在转向起初时有更小的偏航。如果需要大于1.1或小于0.9的值，则通常表示空速校准存在问题。

YAW2SRV_SLIP.Description: 这个参数控制从横向加速度转化到期望的偏航比率的增益。除非需要主动式方向舵控制否则它应当设为0.如果飞机侧飘，这个参数只有当机身拥有足够的侧面积以产生可测量的横向加速度的时候才可以用。机翼和大多数滑翔机无法使用此参数。这个参数只有在基本偏航线阻尼器增益YAW2SRV_DAMP调节后，且积分器增益 YAW2SRV_INT设置完毕后起效。如果只需要偏航阻尼器，设置这个参数为0.

AFS_AMSL_ERR_GPS.DisplayName: Error margin for GPS based AMSL limit
AFS_AMSL_ERR_GPS.Description: This sets margin for error in GPS derived altitude limit. This error margin is only used if the barometer has failed. If the barometer fails then the GPS will be used to enforce the AMSL_LIMIT, but this margin will be subtracted from the AMSL_LIMIT first, to ensure that even with the given amount of GPS altitude error the pressure altitude is not breached. OBC users should set this to comply with their D2 safety case. A value of -1 will mean that barometer failure will lead to immediate termination.

AFS_AMSL_LIMIT.Description: This sets the AMSL (above mean sea level) altitude limit. If the pressure altitude determined by QNH exceeds this limit then flight termination will be forced. Note that this limit is in meters, whereas pressure altitude limits are often quoted in feet. A value of zero disables the pressure altitude limit.

AFS_DUAL_LOSS.DisplayName: Enable dual loss terminate due to failure of both GCS and GPS simultaneously
AFS_DUAL_LOSS.Description: This enables the dual loss termination part of the AFS system. If this parameter is 1 and both GPS and the ground control station fail simultaneously, this will be considered a "dual loss" and cause termination.

AFS_ENABLE.Description: This enables the advanced failsafe system. If this is set to zero (disable) then all the other AFS options have no effect

AFS_GEOFENCE.Description: This enables the geofence part of the AFS. Will only be in effect if AFS_ENABLE is also 1

AFS_GPS_LOSS.Description: Waypoint number to navigate to on GPS lock loss

AFS_HB_PIN.Description: This sets a digital output pin which is cycled at 10Hz when termination is not activated. Note that if a FS_TERM_PIN is set then the heartbeat pin will continue to cycle at 10Hz when termination is activated, to allow the termination board to distinguish between autopilot crash and termination.

AFS_MAN_PIN.Description: This sets a digital output pin to set high when in manual mode

AFS_MAX_COM_LOSS.DisplayName: Maximum number of comms loss events
AFS_MAX_COM_LOSS.Description: Maximum number of comms loss events before the aircraft stops returning to mission on comms recovery. Use zero to allow for any number of comms loss events.

AFS_MAX_GPS_LOSS.DisplayName: Maximum number of GPS loss events
AFS_MAX_GPS_LOSS.Description: Maximum number of GPS loss events before the aircraft stops returning to mission on GPS recovery. Use zero to allow for any number of GPS loss events.

AFS_QNH_PRESSURE.Description: This sets the QNH pressure in millibars to be used for pressure altitude in the altitude limit. A value of zero disables the altitude limit.

AFS_RC.Description: This enables the RC part of the AFS. Will only be in effect if AFS_ENABLE is also 1

AFS_RC_FAIL_TIME.Description: This is the time in seconds in manual mode that failsafe termination will activate if RC input is lost. For the OBC rules this should be (1.5). Use 0 to disable.

AFS_RC_MAN_ONLY.DisplayName: Enable RC Termination only in manual control modes
AFS_RC_MAN_ONLY.Description: If this parameter is set to 1, then an RC loss will only cause the plane to terminate in manual control modes. If it is 0, then the plane will terminate in any flight mode.

AFS_TERM_ACTION.Description: This can be used to force an action on flight termination. Normally this is handled by an external failsafe board, but you can setup APM to handle it here. Please consult the wiki for more information on the possible values of the parameter

AFS_TERM_PIN.Description: This sets a digital output pin to set high on flight termination

AFS_TERMINATE.Description: Can be set in flight to force termination of the heartbeat signal

AFS_WP_COMMS.Description: Waypoint number to navigate to on comms loss

AHRS_COMP_BETA.DisplayName: AHRS Velocity Complementary Filter Beta Coefficient
AHRS_COMP_BETA.Description: This controls the time constant for the cross-over frequency used to fuse AHRS (airspeed and heading) and GPS data to estimate ground velocity. Time constant is 0.1/beta. A larger time constant will use GPS data less and a small time constant will use air data less.

AHRS_CUSTOM_PIT.Description: Autopilot mounting position pitch offset. Positive values = pitch up, negative values = pitch down. This parameter is only used when AHRS_ORIENTATION is set to CUSTOM.

AHRS_CUSTOM_ROLL.Description: Autopilot mounting position roll offset. Positive values = roll right, negative values = roll left. This parameter is only used when AHRS_ORIENTATION is set to CUSTOM.

AHRS_CUSTOM_YAW.Description: Autopilot mounting position yaw offset. Positive values = yaw right, negative values = yaw left. This parameter is only used when AHRS_ORIENTATION is set to CUSTOM.

AHRS_EKF_TYPE.DisplayName: Use NavEKF Kalman filter for attitude and position estimation
AHRS_EKF_TYPE.Description: This controls which NavEKF Kalman filter version is used for attitude and position estimation

AHRS_GPS_GAIN.Description: This controls how much to use the GPS to correct the attitude. This should never be set to zero for a plane as it would result in the plane losing control in turns. For a plane please use the default value of 1.0.

AHRS_GPS_MINSATS.Description: Minimum number of satellites visible to use GPS for velocity based corrections attitude correction. This defaults to 6, which is about the point at which the velocity numbers from a GPS become too unreliable for accurate correction of the accelerometers.

AHRS_GPS_USE.Description: This controls whether to use dead-reckoning or GPS based navigation. If set to 0 then the GPS won't be used for navigation, and only dead reckoning will be used. A value of zero should never be used for normal flight. Currently this affects only the DCM-based AHRS: the EKF uses GPS whenever it is available.

AHRS_ORIENTATION.Description: Overall board orientation relative to the standard orientation for the board type. This rotates the IMU and compass readings to allow the board to be oriented in your vehicle at any 90 or 45 degree angle. This option takes affect on next boot. After changing you will need to re-level your vehicle.

AHRS_RP_P.Description: This controls how fast the accelerometers correct the attitude

AHRS_TRIM_X.Description: Compensates for the roll angle difference between the control board and the frame. Positive values make the vehicle roll right.

AHRS_TRIM_Y.Description: Compensates for the pitch angle difference between the control board and the frame. Positive values make the vehicle pitch up/back.

AHRS_WIND_MAX.Description: This sets the maximum allowable difference between ground speed and airspeed. This allows the plane to cope with a failing airspeed sensor. A value of zero means to use the airspeed as is.

AHRS_YAW_P.Description: This controls the weight the compass or GPS has on the heading. A higher value means the heading will track the yaw source (GPS or compass) more rapidly.

ARMING_ACCTHRESH.Description: Accelerometer error threshold used to determine inconsistent accelerometers. Compares this error range to other accelerometers to detect a hardware or calibration error. Lower value means tighter check and harder to pass arming check. Not all accelerometers are created equal.

ARMING_CHECK.Description: Checks prior to arming motor. This is a bitmask of checks that will be performed before allowing arming. The default is no checks, allowing arming at any time. You can select whatever checks you prefer by adding together the values of each check type to set this parameter. For example, to only allow arming when you have GPS lock and no RC failsafe you would set ARMING_CHECK to 72. For most users it is recommended that you set this to 1 to enable all checks.
ARMING_CHECK.Values: 0:None,1:All,2:Barometer,4:Compass,8:GPS Lock,16:INS(INertial Sensors - accels & gyros),32:Parameters(unused),64:RC Channels,128:Board voltage,256:Battery Level,1024:LoggingAvailable,2048:Hardware safety switch,4096:GPS configuration
ARMING_CHECK.Bitmask: 0:All,1:Barometer,2:Compass,3:GPS lock,4:INS,5:Parameters,6:RC Channels,7:Board voltage,8:Battery Level,10:Logging Available,11:Hardware safety switch,12:GPS Configuration

ARMING_REQUIRE.Description: Arming disabled until some requirements are met. If 0, there are no requirements (arm immediately). If 1, require rudder stick or GCS arming before arming motors and sends the minimum throttle PWM value to the throttle channel when disarmed. If 2, require rudder stick or GCS arming and send 0 PWM to throttle channel when disarmed. See the ARMING_CHECK_* parameters to see what checks are done before arming. Note, if setting this parameter to 0 a reboot is required to arm the plane. Also note, even with this parameter at 0, if ARMING_CHECK parameter is not also zero the plane may fail to arm throttle at boot due to a pre-arm check failure.
ARMING_REQUIRE.Values: 0:Disabled,1:THR_MIN PWM when disarmed,2:0 PWM when disarmed

ARMING_VOLT_MIN.DisplayName: Arming voltage minimum on the first battery
ARMING_VOLT_MIN.Description: The minimum voltage of the first battery required to arm, 0 disables the check

ARMING_VOLT2_MIN.DisplayName: Arming voltage minimum on the second battery
ARMING_VOLT2_MIN.Description: The minimum voltage of the second battery required to arm, 0 disables the check

ATC_ACCEL_MAX.DisplayName: Speed control acceleration (and deceleration) maximum in m/s/s
ATC_ACCEL_MAX.Description: Speed control acceleration (and deceleration) maximum in m/s/s. 0 to disable acceleration limiting

ATC_BRAKE.Description: Speed control brake enable/disable. Allows sending a reversed output to the motors to slow the vehicle.

ATC_DECEL_MAX.DisplayName: Speed control deceleration maximum in m/s/s
ATC_DECEL_MAX.Description: Speed control and deceleration maximum in m/s/s. 0 to use ATC_ACCEL_MAX for deceleration

ATC_SPEED_D.Description: Speed control D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired speed vs actual

ATC_SPEED_FILT.Description: Speed control input filter. Lower values reduce noise but add delay.

ATC_SPEED_I.Description: Speed control I gain. Corrects long term error between the desired speed (in m/s) and actual speed

ATC_SPEED_IMAX.Description: Speed control I gain maximum. Constraings the maximum motor output (range -1 to +1) that the I term will generate

ATC_SPEED_P.Description: Speed control P gain. Converts the error between the desired speed (in m/s) and actual speed to a motor output (in the range -1 to +1)

ATC_STOP_SPEED.Description: Speed control stop speed. Motor outputs to zero once vehicle speed falls below this value

ATC_STR_ACC_MAX.Description: Steering control angular acceleartion maximum (in deg/s/s). 0 to disable acceleration limiting

ATC_STR_ANG_P.Description: Steering control angle P gain. Converts the error between the desired heading/yaw (in radians) and actual heading/yaw to a desired turn rate (in rad/sec)

ATC_STR_RAT_D.Description: Steering control D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired turn rate vs actual

ATC_STR_RAT_FILT.Description: Steering control input filter. Lower values reduce noise but add delay.

ATC_STR_RAT_I.Description: Steering control I gain. Corrects long term error between the desired turn rate (in rad/s) and actual

ATC_STR_RAT_IMAX.Description: Steering control I gain maximum. Constraings the steering output (range -1 to +1) that the I term will generate

ATC_STR_RAT_MAX.Description: Steering control rotation rate maximum in deg/s. 0 to remove rate limiting

ATC_STR_RAT_P.Description: Steering control rate P gain. Converts the turn rate error (in radians/sec) to a steering control output (in the range -1 to +1)

AUTO_KICKSTART.Description: X acceleration in meters/second/second to use to trigger the motor start in auto mode. If set to zero then auto throttle starts immediately when the mode switch happens, otherwise the rover waits for the X acceleration to go above this value before it will start the motor

AUTO_TRIGGER_PIN.Description: pin number to use to enable the throttle in auto mode. If set to -1 then don't use a trigger, otherwise this is a pin number which if held low in auto mode will enable the motor to run. If the switch is released while in AUTO then the motor will stop again. This can be used in combination with INITIAL_MODE to give a 'press button to start' rover with no receiver.
AUTO_TRIGGER_PIN.Values: -1:Disabled,0:APM TriggerPin0,1:APM TriggerPin1,2:APM TriggerPin2,3:APM TriggerPin3,4:APM TriggerPin4,5:APM TriggerPin5,6:APM TriggerPin6,7:APM TriggerPin7,8:APM TriggerPin8,50:Pixhawk TriggerPin50,51:Pixhawk TriggerPin51,52:Pixhawk TriggerPin52,53:Pixhawk TriggerPin53,54:Pixhawk TriggerPin54,55:Pixhawk TriggerPin55

AUX_CH.Description: RC Channel to use for auxiliary functions including saving waypoints

AVOID_ANGLE_MAX.DisplayName: Avoidance max lean angle in non-GPS flight modes
AVOID_ANGLE_MAX.Description: Max lean angle used to avoid obstacles while in non-GPS modes

AVOID_DIST_MAX.DisplayName: Avoidance distance maximum in non-GPS flight modes
AVOID_DIST_MAX.Description: Distance from object at which obstacle avoidance will begin in non-GPS modes

AVOID_MARGIN.DisplayName: Avoidance distance margin in GPS modes
AVOID_MARGIN.Description: Vehicle will attempt to stay at least this distance (in meters) from objects while in GPS modes

BATT_AMP_OFFSET.Description: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor

BATT_AMP_PERVLT.Description: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to. On the APM2 or Pixhawk using the 3DR Power brick this should be set to 17. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 17.

BATT_CAPACITY.Description: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

BATT_CRT_MAH.Description: Battery capacity at which the critical battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the @

BATT_CRT_VOLT.Description: Battery voltage that triggers a critical battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the @

BATT_CURR_PIN.Description: Setting this to 0 ~ 13 will enable battery current sensing on pins A0 ~ A13. On the PX4-v1 it should be set to 101. On the Pixhawk, Pixracer and NAVIO boards it should be set to 3, Pixhawk2 Power2 is 14.

BATT_FS_CRT_ACT.Description: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a critical battery failsafe

BATT_FS_LOW_ACT.Description: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a low battery failsafe

BATT_FS_VOLTSRC.Description: Voltage type used for detection of low voltage event

BATT_LOW_MAH.Description: Battery capacity at which the low battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the @

BATT_LOW_TIMER.Description: This is the timeout in seconds before a low voltage event will be triggered. For aircraft with low C batteries it may be necessary to raise this in order to cope with low voltage on long takeoffs. A value of zero disables low voltage errors.

BATT_LOW_VOLT.Description: Battery voltage that triggers a low battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the @

BATT_MONITOR.Description: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current

BATT_SERIAL_NUM.Description: Battery serial number, automatically filled in for SMBus batteries, otherwise will be -1. With UAVCAN it is the battery_id.

BATT_VOLT_MULT.Description: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (@

BATT_VOLT_PIN.Description: Setting this to 0 ~ 13 will enable battery voltage sensing on pins A0 ~ A13. On the PX4-v1 it should be set to 100. On the Pixhawk, Pixracer and NAVIO boards it should be set to 2, Pixhawk2 Power2 is 13.

BATT_WATT_MAX.Description: If battery wattage (voltage * current) exceeds this value then the system will reduce max throttle (THR_MAX, TKOFF_THR_MAX and THR_MIN for reverse thrust) to satisfy this limit. This helps limit high current to low C rated batteries regardless of battery voltage. The max throttle will slowly grow back to THR_MAX (or TKOFF_THR_MAX ) and THR_MIN if demanding the current max and under the watt max. Use 0 to disable.

BATT2_AMP_OFFSET.Description: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor

BATT2_AMP_PERVLT.Description: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to. On the APM2 or Pixhawk using the 3DR Power brick this should be set to 17. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 17.

BATT2_CAPACITY.Description: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

BATT2_CRT_MAH.Description: Battery capacity at which the critical battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the @

BATT2_CRT_VOLT.Description: Battery voltage that triggers a critical battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the @

BATT2_CURR_PIN.Description: Setting this to 0 ~ 13 will enable battery current sensing on pins A0 ~ A13. On the PX4-v1 it should be set to 101. On the Pixhawk, Pixracer and NAVIO boards it should be set to 3, Pixhawk2 Power2 is 14.

BATT2_FS_CRT_ACT.Description: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a critical battery failsafe

BATT2_FS_LOW_ACT.Description: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a low battery failsafe

BATT2_FS_VOLTSRC.Description: Voltage type used for detection of low voltage event

BATT2_LOW_MAH.Description: Battery capacity at which the low battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the @

BATT2_LOW_TIMER.Description: This is the timeout in seconds before a low voltage event will be triggered. For aircraft with low C batteries it may be necessary to raise this in order to cope with low voltage on long takeoffs. A value of zero disables low voltage errors.

BATT2_LOW_VOLT.Description: Battery voltage that triggers a low battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the @

BATT2_MONITOR.Description: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current

BATT2_SERIAL_NUM.Description: Battery serial number, automatically filled in for SMBus batteries, otherwise will be -1. With UAVCAN it is the battery_id.

BATT2_VOLT_MULT.Description: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (@

BATT2_VOLT_PIN.Description: Setting this to 0 ~ 13 will enable battery voltage sensing on pins A0 ~ A13. On the PX4-v1 it should be set to 100. On the Pixhawk, Pixracer and NAVIO boards it should be set to 2, Pixhawk2 Power2 is 13.

BATT2_WATT_MAX.Description: If battery wattage (voltage * current) exceeds this value then the system will reduce max throttle (THR_MAX, TKOFF_THR_MAX and THR_MIN for reverse thrust) to satisfy this limit. This helps limit high current to low C rated batteries regardless of battery voltage. The max throttle will slowly grow back to THR_MAX (or TKOFF_THR_MAX ) and THR_MIN if demanding the current max and under the watt max. Use 0 to disable.

BCN_ALT.DisplayName: Beacon origin's altitude above sealevel in meters
BCN_ALT.Description: Beacon origin's altitude above sealevel in meters

BCN_ORIENT_YAW.DisplayName: Beacon systems rotation from north in degrees
BCN_ORIENT_YAW.Description: Beacon systems rotation from north in degrees

BCN_TYPE.DisplayName: Beacon based position estimation device type
BCN_TYPE.Description: What type of beacon based position estimation device is connected

BRD_IMU_TARGTEMP.Description: This sets the target IMU temperature for boards with controllable IMU heating units. DO NOT SET -1 on The Cube. A value of -1 sets PH1 behaviour

BRD_IO_ENABLE.Description: This allows for the IO co-processor on FMUv1 and FMUv2 to be disabled

BRD_PWM_COUNT.Description: Control assigning of FMU pins to PWM output, timer capture and GPIO. All unassigned pins can be used for GPIO
BRD_PWM_COUNT.Values: 0:No PWMs,2:Two PWMs,4:Four PWMs,6:Six PWMs,7:Three PWMs and One Capture

BRD_RADIO_ABLVL.Description: This sets the minimum RSSI of an auto-bind packet for it to be accepted. This should be set so that auto-bind will only happen at short range to minimise the change of an auto-bind happening accidentially

BRD_RADIO_ABTIME.Description: When non-zero this sets the time with no transmitter packets before we start looking for auto-bind packets.

BRD_RADIO_BZOFS.Description: Set transmitter buzzer note adjustment (adjust frequency up)

BRD_RADIO_FCCTST.DisplayName: Put radio into FCC test mode
BRD_RADIO_FCCTST.Description: If this is enabled then the radio will continuously transmit as required for FCC testing. The transmit channel is set by the value of the parameter. The radio will not work for RC input while this is enabled

BRD_RADIO_PPSCH.Description: Channel to show received packet-per-second rate, or zero for disabled

BRD_RADIO_SIGCH.Description: Channel to show receive RSSI signal strength, or zero for disabled

BRD_RADIO_STKMD.Description: This selects between different stick input modes. The default is mode2, which has throttle on the left stick and pitch on the right stick. You can instead set mode1, which has throttle on the right stick and pitch on the left stick.

BRD_RADIO_TELEM.Description: If this is non-zero then telemetry packets will be sent over DSM

BRD_RADIO_TESTCH.DisplayName: Set radio to factory test channel
BRD_RADIO_TESTCH.Description: This sets the radio to a fixed test channel for factory testing. Using a fixed channel avoids the need for binding in factory testing.

BRD_RADIO_TPPSCH.Description: Channel to show telemetry packets-per-second value, as received at TX

BRD_RADIO_TSIGCH.DisplayName: RSSI value channel for telemetry data on transmitter
BRD_RADIO_TSIGCH.Description: Channel to show telemetry RSSI value as received by TX

BRD_RADIO_TXMAX.Description: Set transmitter maximum transmit power (from 1 to 8)

BRD_RADIO_TXPOW.Description: Set telemetry transmit power. This is the power level (from 1 to 8) for telemetry packets sent from the RX to the TX

BRD_RADIO_TYPE.DisplayName: Set type of direct attached radio
BRD_RADIO_TYPE.Description: This enables support for direct attached radio receivers

BRD_SAFETY_MASK.DisplayName: Channels to which ignore the safety switch state
BRD_SAFETY_MASK.Description: A bitmask which controls what channels can move while the safety switch has not been pressed

BRD_SAFETYENABLE.DisplayName: Enable use of safety arming switch
BRD_SAFETYENABLE.Description: This controls the default state of the safety switch at startup. When set to 1 the safety switch will start in the safe state (flashing) at boot. When set to zero the safety switch will start in the unsafe state (solid) at startup. Note that if a safety switch is fitted the user can still control the safety state after startup using the switch. The safety state can also be controlled in software using a MAVLink message.

BRD_SAFETYOPTION.Description: This controls the activation of the safety button. It allows you to control if the safety button can be used for safety enable and/or disable, and whether the button is only active when disarmed

BRD_SBUS_OUT.Description: This sets the SBUS output frame rate in Hz

BRD_SER1_RTSCTS.Description: Enable flow control on serial 1 (telemetry 1) on Pixhawk. You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup. Note that the PX4v1 does not have hardware flow control pins on this port, so you should leave this disabled.

BRD_SER2_RTSCTS.Description: Enable flow control on serial 2 (telemetry 2) on Pixhawk and STATE. You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup.

BRD_SERIAL_NUM.Description: User-defined serial number of this vehicle, it can be any arbitrary number you want and has no effect on the autopilot

BRD_TYPE.Description: This allows selection of a PX4 or VRBRAIN board type. If set to zero then the board type is auto-detected (PX4)
BRD_TYPE.Values: 0:AUTO,1:PX4V1,2:Pixhawk,3:Cube/Pixhawk2,4:Pixracer,5:PixhawkMini,6:Pixhawk2Slim,7:VRBrain 5.1,8:VRBrain 5.2,9:VR Micro Brain 5.1,10:VR Micro Brain 5.2,11:VRBrain Core 1.0,12:VRBrain 5.4,13:Intel Aero FC,20:AUAV2.1

BTN_ENABLE.Description: This enables the button checking module. When this is disabled the parameters for setting button inputs are not visible

BTN_PIN1.Description: Digital pin number for first button input.
BTN_PIN1.Values: -1:Disabled,50:Pixhawk AUXOUT1,51:Pixhawk AUXOUT2,52:Pixhawk AUXOUT3,53:Pixhawk AUXOUT4,54:Pixhawk AUXOUT5,55:Pixhawk AUXOUT6,111:PX4 FMU Relay1,112:PX4 FMU Relay2,113:PX4IO Relay1,114:PX4IO Relay2,115:PX4IO ACC1,116:PX4IO ACC2

BTN_PIN2.Description: Digital pin number for second button input.
BTN_PIN2.Values: -1:Disabled,50:Pixhawk AUXOUT1,51:Pixhawk AUXOUT2,52:Pixhawk AUXOUT3,53:Pixhawk AUXOUT4,54:Pixhawk AUXOUT5,55:Pixhawk AUXOUT6,111:PX4 FMU Relay1,112:PX4 FMU Relay2,113:PX4IO Relay1,114:PX4IO Relay2,115:PX4IO ACC1,116:PX4IO ACC2

BTN_PIN3.Description: Digital pin number for third button input.
BTN_PIN3.Values: -1:Disabled,50:Pixhawk AUXOUT1,51:Pixhawk AUXOUT2,52:Pixhawk AUXOUT3,53:Pixhawk AUXOUT4,54:Pixhawk AUXOUT5,55:Pixhawk AUXOUT6,111:PX4 FMU Relay1,112:PX4 FMU Relay2,113:PX4IO Relay1,114:PX4IO Relay2,115:PX4IO ACC1,116:PX4IO ACC2

BTN_PIN4.Description: Digital pin number for fourth button input.
BTN_PIN4.Values: -1:Disabled,50:Pixhawk AUXOUT1,51:Pixhawk AUXOUT2,52:Pixhawk AUXOUT3,53:Pixhawk AUXOUT4,54:Pixhawk AUXOUT5,55:Pixhawk AUXOUT6,111:PX4 FMU Relay1,112:PX4 FMU Relay2,113:PX4IO Relay1,114:PX4IO Relay2,115:PX4IO ACC1,116:PX4IO ACC2

BTN_REPORT_SEND.Description: The duration in seconds that a BUTTON_CHANGE report is repeatedly sent to the GCS regarding a button changing state. Note that the BUTTON_CHANGE message is MAVLink2 only.

CAM_AUTO_ONLY.Description: When enabled, trigging by distance is done in AUTO mode only.

CAM_DURATION.DisplayName: Duration that shutter is held open
CAM_DURATION.Description: How long the shutter will be held open in 10ths of a second (i.e. enter 10 for 1second, 50 for 5seconds)

CAM_FEEDBACK_PIN.Description: pin number to use for save accurate camera feedback messages. If set to -1 then don't use a pin flag for this, otherwise this is a pin number which if held high after a picture trigger order, will save camera messages when camera really takes a picture. A universal camera hot shoe is needed. The pin should be held high for at least 2 milliseconds for reliable trigger detection. See also the CAM_FEEDBACK_POL option. If using AUX4 pin on a Pixhawk then a fast capture method is used that allows for the trigger time to be as short as one microsecond.
CAM_FEEDBACK_PIN.Values: -1:Disabled,50:PX4 AUX1,51:PX4 AUX2,52:PX4 AUX3,53:PX4 AUX4(fast capture),54:PX4 AUX5,55:PX4 AUX6

CAM_FEEDBACK_POL.Description: Polarity for feedback pin. If this is 1 then the feedback pin should go high on trigger. If set to 0 then it should go low

CAM_MAX_ROLL.Description: Postpone shooting if roll is greater than limit. (0=Disable, will shoot regardless of roll).

CAM_MIN_INTERVAL.Description: Postpone shooting if previous picture was taken less than preset time(ms) ago.

CAM_RELAY_ON.Description: This sets whether the relay goes high or low when it triggers. Note that you should also set RELAY_DEFAULT appropriately for your camera

CAM_SERVO_OFF.Description: PWM value in microseconds to move servo to when shutter is deactivated

CAM_SERVO_ON.Description: PWM value in microseconds to move servo to when shutter is activated

CAM_TRIGG_DIST.Description: Distance in meters between camera triggers. If this value is non-zero then the camera will trigger whenever the GPS position changes by this number of meters regardless of what mode the APM is in. Note that this parameter can also be set in an auto mission using the DO_SET_CAM_TRIGG_DIST command, allowing you to enable/disable the triggering of the camera during the flight.

CAM_TRIGG_TYPE.Description: how to trigger the camera to take a picture

CAN_D1_PROTOCOL.DisplayName: Enable use of specific protocol over virtual driver
CAN_D1_PROTOCOL.Description: Enabling this option starts selected protocol that will use this virtual driver

CAN_D1_UC_ESC_BM.DisplayName: RC Out channels to be transmitted as ESC over UAVCAN
CAN_D1_UC_ESC_BM.Description: Bitmask with one set for channel to be transmitted as a ESC command over UAVCAN

CAN_D1_UC_NODE.DisplayName: UAVCAN node that is used for this network
CAN_D1_UC_NODE.Description: UAVCAN node should be set implicitly

CAN_D1_UC_SRV_BM.DisplayName: RC Out channels to be transmitted as servo over UAVCAN
CAN_D1_UC_SRV_BM.Description: Bitmask with one set for channel to be transmitted as a servo command over UAVCAN
CAN_D1_UC_SRV_BM.Bitmask: 0: Servo 1, 1: Servo 2, 2: Servo 3, 3: Servo 4, 4: Servo 5, 5: Servo 6, 6: Servo 7, 7: Servo 8, 8: Servo 9, 9: Servo 10, 10: Servo 11, 11: Servo 12, 12: Servo 13, 13: Servo 14, 14: Servo 15

CAN_D1_UC_SRV_RT.Description: Maximum transmit rate for servo outputs

CAN_D2_PROTOCOL.DisplayName: Enable use of specific protocol over virtual driver
CAN_D2_PROTOCOL.Description: Enabling this option starts selected protocol that will use this virtual driver

CAN_D2_UC_ESC_BM.DisplayName: RC Out channels to be transmitted as ESC over UAVCAN
CAN_D2_UC_ESC_BM.Description: Bitmask with one set for channel to be transmitted as a ESC command over UAVCAN

CAN_D2_UC_NODE.DisplayName: UAVCAN node that is used for this network
CAN_D2_UC_NODE.Description: UAVCAN node should be set implicitly

CAN_D2_UC_SRV_BM.DisplayName: RC Out channels to be transmitted as servo over UAVCAN
CAN_D2_UC_SRV_BM.Description: Bitmask with one set for channel to be transmitted as a servo command over UAVCAN
CAN_D2_UC_SRV_BM.Bitmask: 0: Servo 1, 1: Servo 2, 2: Servo 3, 3: Servo 4, 4: Servo 5, 5: Servo 6, 6: Servo 7, 7: Servo 8, 8: Servo 9, 9: Servo 10, 10: Servo 11, 11: Servo 12, 12: Servo 13, 13: Servo 14, 14: Servo 15

CAN_D2_UC_SRV_RT.Description: Maximum transmit rate for servo outputs

CAN_D3_PROTOCOL.DisplayName: Enable use of specific protocol over virtual driver
CAN_D3_PROTOCOL.Description: Enabling this option starts selected protocol that will use this virtual driver

CAN_D3_UC_ESC_BM.DisplayName: RC Out channels to be transmitted as ESC over UAVCAN
CAN_D3_UC_ESC_BM.Description: Bitmask with one set for channel to be transmitted as a ESC command over UAVCAN

CAN_D3_UC_NODE.DisplayName: UAVCAN node that is used for this network
CAN_D3_UC_NODE.Description: UAVCAN node should be set implicitly

CAN_D3_UC_SRV_BM.DisplayName: RC Out channels to be transmitted as servo over UAVCAN
CAN_D3_UC_SRV_BM.Description: Bitmask with one set for channel to be transmitted as a servo command over UAVCAN
CAN_D3_UC_SRV_BM.Bitmask: 0: Servo 1, 1: Servo 2, 2: Servo 3, 3: Servo 4, 4: Servo 5, 5: Servo 6, 6: Servo 7, 7: Servo 8, 8: Servo 9, 9: Servo 10, 10: Servo 11, 11: Servo 12, 12: Servo 13, 13: Servo 14, 14: Servo 15

CAN_D3_UC_SRV_RT.Description: Maximum transmit rate for servo outputs

CAN_P1_BITRATE.Description: Bit rate can be set up to from 10000 to 1000000

CAN_P1_DEBUG.DisplayName: Level of debug for CAN devices
CAN_P1_DEBUG.Description: Enabling this option will provide debug messages

CAN_P1_DRIVER.DisplayName: Index of virtual driver to be used with physical CAN interface
CAN_P1_DRIVER.Description: Enabling this option enables use of CAN buses.

CAN_P2_BITRATE.Description: Bit rate can be set up to from 10000 to 1000000

CAN_P2_DEBUG.DisplayName: Level of debug for CAN devices
CAN_P2_DEBUG.Description: Enabling this option will provide debug messages

CAN_P2_DRIVER.DisplayName: Index of virtual driver to be used with physical CAN interface
CAN_P2_DRIVER.Description: Enabling this option enables use of CAN buses.

CAN_P3_BITRATE.Description: Bit rate can be set up to from 10000 to 1000000

CAN_P3_DEBUG.DisplayName: Level of debug for CAN devices
CAN_P3_DEBUG.Description: Enabling this option will provide debug messages

CAN_P3_DRIVER.DisplayName: Index of virtual driver to be used with physical CAN interface
CAN_P3_DRIVER.Description: Enabling this option enables use of CAN buses.

CH7_OPTION.Description: What to do use channel 7 for

COMPASS_AUTODEC.Description: Enable or disable the automatic calculation of the declination based on gps location

COMPASS_CAL_FIT.Description: This controls the fitness level required for a successful compass calibration. A lower value makes for a stricter fit (less likely to pass). This is the value used for the primary magnetometer. Other magnetometers get double the value.

COMPASS_DEC.Description: An angle to compensate between the true north and magnetic north

COMPASS_DEV_ID.Description: Compass device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

COMPASS_DEV_ID2.Description: Second compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

COMPASS_DEV_ID3.Description: Third compass's device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

COMPASS_DIA_X.Description: DIA_X in the compass soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA_Y.Description: DIA_Y in the compass soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA_Z.Description: DIA_Z in the compass soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA2_X.Description: DIA_X in the compass2 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA2_Y.Description: DIA_Y in the compass2 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA2_Z.Description: DIA_Z in the compass2 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA3_X.Description: DIA_X in the compass3 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA3_Y.Description: DIA_Y in the compass3 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_DIA3_Z.Description: DIA_Z in the compass3 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_EXTERN2.DisplayName: Compass2 is attached via an external cable
COMPASS_EXTERN2.Description: Configure second compass so it is attached externally. This is auto-detected on PX4 and Pixhawk. If set to 0 or 1 then auto-detection by bus connection can override the value. If set to 2 then auto-detection will be disabled.

COMPASS_EXTERN3.DisplayName: Compass3 is attached via an external cable
COMPASS_EXTERN3.Description: Configure third compass so it is attached externally. This is auto-detected on PX4 and Pixhawk. If set to 0 or 1 then auto-detection by bus connection can override the value. If set to 2 then auto-detection will be disabled.

COMPASS_EXTERNAL.DisplayName: Compass is attached via an external cable
COMPASS_EXTERNAL.Description: Configure compass so it is attached externally. This is auto-detected on PX4 and Pixhawk. Set to 1 if the compass is externally connected. When externally connected the COMPASS_ORIENT option operates independently of the AHRS_ORIENTATION board orientation option. If set to 0 or 1 then auto-detection by bus connection can override the value. If set to 2 then auto-detection will be disabled.

COMPASS_FLTR_RNG.DisplayName: Range in which sample is accepted
COMPASS_FLTR_RNG.Description: This sets the range around the average value that new samples must be within to be accepted. This can help reduce the impact of noise on sensors that are on long I2C cables. The value is a percentage from the average value. A value of zero disables this filter.

COMPASS_LEARN.Description: Enable or disable the automatic learning of compass offsets. You can enable learning either using a compass-only method that is suitable only for fixed wing aircraft or using the offsets learnt by the active EKF state estimator. If this option is enabled then the learnt offsets are saved when you disarm the vehicle.

COMPASS_MOT_X.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation for body frame X axis
COMPASS_MOT_X.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's x-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

COMPASS_MOT_Y.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation for body frame Y axis
COMPASS_MOT_Y.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's y-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

COMPASS_MOT_Z.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation for body frame Z axis
COMPASS_MOT_Z.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's z-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

COMPASS_MOT2_X.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation to compass2 for body frame X axis
COMPASS_MOT2_X.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass2's x-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

COMPASS_MOT2_Y.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation to compass2 for body frame Y axis
COMPASS_MOT2_Y.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass2's y-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

COMPASS_MOT2_Z.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation to compass2 for body frame Z axis
COMPASS_MOT2_Z.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass2's z-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

COMPASS_MOT3_X.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation to compass3 for body frame X axis
COMPASS_MOT3_X.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass3's x-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

COMPASS_MOT3_Y.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation to compass3 for body frame Y axis
COMPASS_MOT3_Y.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass3's y-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

COMPASS_MOT3_Z.DisplayName: Motor interference compensation to compass3 for body frame Z axis
COMPASS_MOT3_Z.Description: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass3's z-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

COMPASS_MOTCT.Description: Set motor interference compensation type to disabled, throttle or current. Do not change manually.

COMPASS_ODI_X.Description: ODI_X in the compass soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ODI_Y.Description: ODI_Y in the compass soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ODI_Z.Description: ODI_Z in the compass soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ODI2_X.Description: ODI_X in the compass2 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ODI2_Y.Description: ODI_Y in the compass2 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ODI2_Z.Description: ODI_Z in the compass2 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ODI3_X.Description: ODI_X in the compass3 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ODI3_Y.Description: ODI_Y in the compass3 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_ODI3_Z.Description: ODI_Z in the compass3 soft-iron calibration matrix: [[DIA_X, ODI_X, ODI_Y], [ODI_X, DIA_Y, ODI_Z], [ODI_Y, ODI_Z, DIA_Z]]

COMPASS_OFFS_MAX.Description: This sets the maximum allowed compass offset in calibration and arming checks

COMPASS_OFS_X.DisplayName: Compass offsets in milligauss on the X axis
COMPASS_OFS_X.Description: Offset to be added to the compass x-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

COMPASS_OFS_Y.DisplayName: Compass offsets in milligauss on the Y axis
COMPASS_OFS_Y.Description: Offset to be added to the compass y-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

COMPASS_OFS_Z.DisplayName: Compass offsets in milligauss on the Z axis
COMPASS_OFS_Z.Description: Offset to be added to the compass z-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

COMPASS_OFS2_X.DisplayName: Compass2 offsets in milligauss on the X axis
COMPASS_OFS2_X.Description: Offset to be added to compass2's x-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

COMPASS_OFS2_Y.DisplayName: Compass2 offsets in milligauss on the Y axis
COMPASS_OFS2_Y.Description: Offset to be added to compass2's y-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

COMPASS_OFS2_Z.DisplayName: Compass2 offsets in milligauss on the Z axis
COMPASS_OFS2_Z.Description: Offset to be added to compass2's z-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

COMPASS_OFS3_X.DisplayName: Compass3 offsets in milligauss on the X axis
COMPASS_OFS3_X.Description: Offset to be added to compass3's x-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

COMPASS_OFS3_Y.DisplayName: Compass3 offsets in milligauss on the Y axis
COMPASS_OFS3_Y.Description: Offset to be added to compass3's y-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

COMPASS_OFS3_Z.DisplayName: Compass3 offsets in milligauss on the Z axis
COMPASS_OFS3_Z.Description: Offset to be added to compass3's z-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

COMPASS_ORIENT.Description: The orientation of the first external compass relative to the vehicle frame. This value will be ignored unless this compass is set as an external compass. When set correctly in the northern hemisphere, pointing the nose and right side down should increase the MagX and MagY values respectively. Rolling the vehicle upside down should decrease the MagZ value. For southern hemisphere, switch increase and decrease. NOTE: For internal compasses, AHRS_ORIENT is used.

COMPASS_ORIENT2.Description: The orientation of a second external compass relative to the vehicle frame. This value will be ignored unless this compass is set as an external compass. When set correctly in the northern hemisphere, pointing the nose and right side down should increase the MagX and MagY values respectively. Rolling the vehicle upside down should decrease the MagZ value. For southern hemisphere, switch increase and decrease. NOTE: For internal compasses, AHRS_ORIENT is used.

COMPASS_ORIENT3.Description: The orientation of a third external compass relative to the vehicle frame. This value will be ignored unless this compass is set as an external compass. When set correctly in the northern hemisphere, pointing the nose and right side down should increase the MagX and MagY values respectively. Rolling the vehicle upside down should decrease the MagZ value. For southern hemisphere, switch increase and decrease. NOTE: For internal compasses, AHRS_ORIENT is used.

COMPASS_PMOT_EXP.Description: This is the exponential correction for the power output of the motor for per-motor compass correction

COMPASS_PMOT1_X.Description: Compensation for X axis of motor1

COMPASS_PMOT1_Y.Description: Compensation for Y axis of motor1

COMPASS_PMOT1_Z.Description: Compensation for Z axis of motor1

COMPASS_PMOT2_X.Description: Compensation for X axis of motor2

COMPASS_PMOT2_Y.Description: Compensation for Y axis of motor2

COMPASS_PMOT2_Z.Description: Compensation for Z axis of motor2

COMPASS_PMOT3_X.Description: Compensation for X axis of motor3

COMPASS_PMOT3_Y.Description: Compensation for Y axis of motor3

COMPASS_PMOT3_Z.Description: Compensation for Z axis of motor3

COMPASS_PMOT4_X.Description: Compensation for X axis of motor4

COMPASS_PMOT4_Y.Description: Compensation for Y axis of motor4

COMPASS_PMOT4_Z.Description: Compensation for Z axis of motor4

COMPASS_PRIMARY.Description: If more than one compass is available, this selects which compass is the primary. When external compasses are connected, they will be ordered first. NOTE: If no external compass is attached, this parameter is ignored.

COMPASS_TYPEMASK.Description: This is a bitmask of driver types to disable. If a driver type is set in this mask then that driver will not try to find a sensor at startup

COMPASS_USE.Description: Enable or disable the use of the compass (instead of the GPS) for determining heading

COMPASS_USE2.Description: Enable or disable the second compass for determining heading.

COMPASS_USE3.Description: Enable or disable the third compass for determining heading.

CRUISE_SPEED.DisplayName: Target cruise speed in auto modes
CRUISE_SPEED.Description: The target speed in auto missions.

CRUISE_THROTTLE.Description: The base throttle percentage to use in auto mode. The CRUISE_SPEED parameter controls the target speed, but the rover starts with the CRUISE_THROTTLE setting as the initial estimate for how much throttle is needed to achieve that speed. It then adjusts the throttle based on how fast the rover is actually going.

EK2_ABIAS_P_NSE.Description: This noise controls the growth of the vertical accelerometer delta velocity bias state error estimate. Increasing it makes accelerometer bias estimation faster and noisier.

EK2_ACC_P_NSE.Description: This control disturbance noise controls the growth of estimated error due to accelerometer measurement errors excluding bias. Increasing it makes the flter trust the accelerometer measurements less and other measurements more.

EK2_ALT_M_NSE.Description: This is the RMS value of noise in the altitude measurement. Increasing it reduces the weighting of the baro measurement and will make the filter respond more slowly to baro measurement errors, but will make it more sensitive to GPS and accelerometer errors.

EK2_ALT_SOURCE.Description: This parameter controls the primary height sensor used by the EKF. If the selected option cannot be used, it will default to Baro as the primary height source. Setting 0 will use the baro altitude at all times. Setting 1 uses the range finder and is only available in combination with optical flow navigation (EK2_GPS_TYPE = 3). Setting 2 uses GPS. Setting 3 uses the range beacon data. NOTE - the EK2_RNG_USE_HGT parameter can be used to switch to range-finder when close to the ground.
EK2_ALT_SOURCE.Values: 0:Use Baro, 1:Use Range Finder, 2:Use GPS, 3:Use Range Beacon

EK2_BCN_DELAY.Description: This is the number of msec that the range beacon measurements lag behind the inertial measurements. It is the time from the end of the optical flow averaging period and does not include the time delay due to the 100msec of averaging within the flow sensor.

EK2_BCN_I_GTE.Description: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the range beacon measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

EK2_BCN_M_NSE.Description: This is the RMS value of noise in the range beacon measurement. Increasing it reduces the weighting on this measurement.

EK2_CHECK_SCALE.Description: This scales the thresholds that are used to check GPS accuracy before it is used by the EKF. A value of 100 is the default. Values greater than 100 increase and values less than 100 reduce the maximum GPS error the EKF will accept. A value of 200 will double the allowable GPS error.

EK2_EAS_I_GATE.Description: This sets the percentage number of standard deviations applied to the airspeed measurement innovation consistency check. Decreasing it makes it more likely that good measurements will be rejected. Increasing it makes it more likely that bad measurements will be accepted.

EK2_EAS_M_NSE.Description: This is the RMS value of noise in equivalent airspeed measurements used by planes. Increasing it reduces the weighting of airspeed measurements and will make wind speed estimates less noisy and slower to converge. Increasing also increases navigation errors when dead-reckoning without GPS measurements.
